Eq. 10.6; [ ἱμάτιον] θάτερον Eup. 159.6; πλοῦτον ἕτερον Philem. 201; occupy a position left by the enemy, Plb. 10.40.11, etc.; μ. τὴν ἀρχήν succeed to the government, Id. 5.40.6, cf. PTeb. 79.49 (ii B. C.); μ. τὸν λόγον take up the discourse, i.e. answer, Plb. 18.2.2; μ. alone, Id. 10.38.1, etc.; οἱ παρά τινος -λημψόμενοι his successors in title, PTeb. 294.18 (ii A. D.), etc.; ἐκ διαδοχῆς μ. τὸ ἱερόν Stud.Pal. 22.184.95 (ii A. D.).
come after, come on, ἅμα τῷ μεταλαβεῖν τὸ τῆς νυκτός Plb. 15.30.2.

data.quote: ἅμα τῷ μεταλαβεῖν τὸ τῆς νυκτός

children.label: III
children.definition: take instead, take in exchange, substitute, πόλεμον ἀντʼ εἰρήνης Th. 1.120; ἄλλο ὄνομα ἀντὶ τῆς ἡδονῆς Pl. Prt. 355c; διαναπαύσωμεν αὐτὸν μεταλαβόντες αὐτοῦ τὸν συγγυμναστήν; Id. Plt. 257c; τὰ ὄργανα τἀλλήλων Id. R. 434a, cf. b; μ. τὰ ἐπιτηδεύματα ἐς τὸ ὁμοῖον adopt new customs so as to resemble others, Th. 6.18, cf. Pl. Prt. 356d; ἱμάτια, ἐσθῆτας μ., X. Cyr. 4.5.4, Plb. 3.78.3; μ. παλτόν take another javelin, X. Eq. 12.13: c. inf., ἀντὶ τοῦ αἰεὶ φυλάσσεσθαι . . [τὸ] ἀντεπιβουλεῦσαι μ. Th. 6.87.

data.quote: ἀντὶ τοῦ αἰεὶ φυλάσσεσθαι . . [τὸ] ἀντεπιβουλεῦσαι μ.

children.label: IV
children.definition: Pass., to be changed, Sor. 2.9, Olymp. in Mete. 36.19.
to be transferred, conveyed, ὑπὸ δηχθέντος Ruf. Fr. 118, cf. Sor. 2.7.
to be changed, altered, εἰς . . A.D. Synt. 107.2; also, of words, have their construction altered, εἰς . . Id. Pron. 15.11, al.; but μ. ἐκ . . to be used in place of, Id. Synt. 195.14, al.

children.label: V
children.definition: take words in another sense, τὰ πράγματα τοῖς ὀνόμασι μ. Hld. 9.9, cf. Them. in de An. 18.35; parody, Ath. 8.336f ( Pass.).
translate, interpret, Ph. 1.480 ( Pass.).

children.label: VI
children.definition: Arist., τὸ μεταλαμβανόμενον proposition substituted for the original thesis in hypothetical reasoning, APr. 41a39.
feel remorse at, rue, μ. τὸ δίκαιον ἔρξαι (nisi leg. ἔρξας) A. Supp. 405 codd. (lyr.).
bringing sorrow in its train, prob.l., A. Supp. 111 (lyr.).
change in growing, μεταλδήσκοντας ὀδόντας ἀνδράσι τευχηστῇσι δέμας growing into armed men, A.R. 3.414.
leave off, cease from, c. gen., μεταλλήξαντι χόλοιο Il. 9.157, cf. h.Cer. 339: abs., in Ep. impf. μεταλλήγεσκεν, A.R. 3.951.
one must have a share of, τῷ ἑνὶ μ. οὐσίας Pl. Prm. 163d: abs., Iamb. Protr. 21. ιθ.

children.label: II
children.definition: one must take instead, τι ἀντί τινος Arist. APr. 48a27.

children.label: III
children.definition: μεταληπτέα, one must resume, τοῦ προτέρου λόγου Agath. 3.1.
capable of partaking of, c. gen., Porph. Chr. 39; ἀρσενικοῦ γένους Eust. 26.31; τὸ μ. capability of receiving form, Platonic name for ὕλη, Arist. Ph. 209b12, Placit. 1.19.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: reversed, ‘translated’, κίνησις Gal. UP 7.14; τάσις, ἔντασις, Id. 10.443, 18(2).506.

children.label: III
children.definition: concerning or involving μετάληψις II 4. Adv. -κῶς Trypho Trop. 5, Heraclit. All. 26, Sch. Ar. Pl. 18.
involving μετάληψις II.5, προβλήματα Syrian. in Hermog. 2.153 R.; τρόποι Aps. p.249 H.

participation, Pl. Prm. 131a; λόγων in philosophy, Id. R. 539d; γένεσις μ. οὐσίας Id. Def. 411a; γίνεσθαι κατὰ τὴν μ. [τοῦ εἴδους] Arist. GC 335b14, cf. Metaph. 1072b20, etc.; partaking of food, 1 Ep.Ti. 4.3.
concurrence, POxy. 1273.39 (iii A. D.), etc.
τὸ λέγων μ. ἐνεστῶτος καὶ παρατατικοῦ is shared by . . , A.D. Adv. 124.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: alternation, τῶν λόγων Pl. Tht. 173b; αἱ μ. τοῦ σχήματος Plb. 9.20.2; ἐκ μεταλήψεως Id. 2.33.4.
succession, μ. τῆς ἀρχῆς Id. 31.13.3.
taking one thing instead of another, ἡ ἀντὶ τοῦ μείζονος ἐλάττονος μ. Arist. Rh. 1369b25.

data.quote: ἡ ἀντὶ τοῦ μείζονος ἐλάττονος μ.

children.definition: use of one word for another, as of Ἥφαιστος for πῦρ, Quint. 8.6.37, Trypho Trop. 5, etc.; transference of meaning, Eust. 79.12.
objection, counterplea, Sch. Pl. Euthphr. 4d; esp. concurrence coupled with objection, Syrian. in Hermog. 2.153 R., Corn. Rh. p.391 H.
συλλογισμοὶ κατὰ μετάληψιν hypothetical syllogisms involving the substitution of a proposition for the original thesis, Arist. APr. 45b17; cf. μεταλαμβάνω VI.
change of construction, A.D. Synt. 210.3; change in dialect, ib. 335.1; change of name, Demetr.Lac. Herc. 1014.60.
translation, rendering, Eust. ad D.P. 180; ἡ εἰς τὸ Ἑλληνικὸν μ. Id.ib. 294.
transference, αἱ ἐς νεφροὺς καὶ κύστιας -λήψιες Aret. SD 1.9.
κατὰ μετάληψιν κατατεῖναι, of reflex tension over a pulley (cf. μεταληπτικός II), Heliod. ap. Orib. 48.9.25.
one must transplant, Gp. 9.5.11.

change, Epich. 170.14, Hp. Aph. 3.1 (pl.); ἡ μ. τῶν σκελέων alternation of the legs in walking, Id. Art. 58; μ. τῆς ἡμέρης eclipse, Hdt. 1.74; ἐν μεταλλαγᾷ πολυμηχάνου ἀνδρός by receiving a crafty man forthy master instead [of me], S. Ph. 1134; μεταλλαγαῖς εἰς ἄλληλα Pl. Ti. 61c.

μ. πολέμου change from war, X. HG 7.4.10, cf. E. HF 765, 766 (lyr.); μ. τοῦ βίου, i. e. death, Phld. Acad.Ind. p.93 M., Plu. Cons.Apoll. 2.101f; μ. alone, decease, ἡ τοῦ Καρνεάδου μ. Phld. l.c., cf. D.S. 18.9, D.C. 57.4; βασιλέων μεταλλαγαί ‘the Deaths of Kings’, title of work by Anaximenes, Ath. 12.531d; of Alexander the Great, Marm.Par. 109.
change for the worse, ruin, εἰς μ. ἀγαγεῖν Men. Pk. 29.

children.label: II
children.definition: exchange, interchange, τῶν ἐπιστημῶν Pl. Tht. 199c.
one must change, Ph. Bel. 93.36; τὰς πτώσεις Sch. E. Hec. 846.
one that changes, μ. πουλύπουν χροός Ion Trag. 36.
changed, altered, δαίμων A. Th. 706 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: to be changed or altered, Pi. Fr. 220.
X. Cyn. 4.4, Poll. 5.61, [ Longin.] Rh. p.191 H. (pl.).
overseer of mines, OGI 660 ( Egypt, i A. D.), Paul.Al. N. 3.

definition: μεταλλάσσω, Att. μεταλλάττω, pf. μετήλλᾰχα and irreg. μετήλλᾰγα (v. infr.):— Pass., irreg. aor. 2 inf. μεταλλάγειν Supp.Epigr. 3.674A24 ( Rhodes, ii B. C.):—

children.definition: change, alter, θέσμια Hdt. 1.59; τὰν ἀνθρώπου ζόαν ἆται . . μεταλλάσσουσι S. Fr. 592.6; πότμος . . μ. φύσιν ib. 871.2; μεταβολὴν βίου μ. Pl. Lg. 775c; οὐ γὰρ τὸν τρόπον, ἀλλὰ τὸν τόπον μετήλλαξεν Aeschin. 3.78; μετήλλαξαν τὴν ἀλήθειαν ἐν τῷ ψεύδει Ep.Rom. 1.25; πόνου μεταλλαχθέντος οἱ πόνοι γλυκεῖς S. Fr. 374; τὰς τύχας ἑκατέρων μετήλλαξαν interchanged them, Isoc. 4.59.

data.quote: οὐ γὰρ τὸν τρόπον, ἀλλὰ τὸν τόπον μετήλλαξεν
μετήλλαξαν τὴν ἀλήθειαν ἐν τῷ ψεύδει

children.label: II
children.definition: exchange,

take in exchange, adopt, assume, ὀρνίθων μεταλλάξας φύσιν Ar. Av. 117; μ. τόπον go into a new country, Pl. Lg. 760c; μ. χώραν ἑτέραν ἐξ ἑτέρας Id. Prm. 138c; ἑτέραν μ. τινὰ χώραν Lycurg. 86; μ. διάφορα βρώματα to have varieties of food, Antiph. 246:— Med., μεταλλάσσεσθαι χιτῶνα Lys. Fr. 21; τὴν τύχην Din. 1.92.

exchange by leaving, quit, μ. τὸν βίον Isoc. 6.17, 9.15, OGI 56.55 ( Canopus, iii B. C.), UPZ 19.14, al. (ii B. C.); τὸ ζῆν μ. νόσῳ Phld. Acad.Ind. p.96 M.: μ. alone, Pl. Ax. 367c, Sotion p.185 W., Abh.Berl.Akad. 1925(5).28 ( Cyrene, i B. C. /i A. D.); οἱ μετηλλαχότες the dead, Pl. Ax. 369b, cf. Supp.Epigr. 3.367.39 ( Boeot., ii B. C.), BGU 1148.8 (i B. C.), etc.; Dor. μεταλλαχώς Test.Epict. 1.10; μεταλλαγότων (sic) IG 5(1).1433.37; also οἱ μεταλλάξαντες ib. 2(2).1323.10; ἐξ ἀνθρώπων D.S. 18.56 (edict of Polyperchon, 319 B.C.).

children.label: III
children.definition: undergo a change, change, Epich. 170.15, Hdt. 2.77, E. Fr. 262, Arist. HA 578b10: with neut. Pron., τοσοῦτο μετήλλαξε κατὰ τὸν βίον Phld. Acad.Ind. p.49 M.: c. gen., change from, Th. 8.70.

children.label: IV
children.definition: substitute, transfer, τινὰς εἰς τήν τινων χώραν Pl. Ti. 19a.
to be searched out, Pi. P. 4.164.
search carefully, inquire diligently, ἐμοὶ οὐ φίλον ἐστὶ μεταλλῆσαι καὶ ἐρέσθαι Od. 14.378; οὐκέτι μέμνηται . . , οὐδὲ μεταλλᾷ 15.23.

data.quote: ἐμοὶ οὐ φίλον ἐστὶ μεταλλῆσαι καὶ ἐρέσθαι

children.definition: inquire of, question, σε . . οὔτʼ εἴρομαι οὔτε μεταλλῶ Il. 1.553, cf. Od. 3.69, 16.287; but ἀντεφθέγξατο . . μετάλλασέν τέ νιν the voice sought him out, Pi. O. 6.62.

inquire about, ask after, μή τι σὺ ταῦτα διείρεο μηδὲ μετάλλα Il. 1.550, cf. 5.516; ἕταροι δὲ κατέκταθεν, οὓς σὺ μεταλλᾷς 13.780, cf. 10.125, Od. 19.190; ἕκαστα μ. 14.128, cf. 16.465: also with Preps., μεταλλῆσαι . . ἀμφὶ πόσει 17.554; ἀμφʼ ἑτάροιο μ. τὰ ἕκαστα A.R. 4.1471; θεῶν πέρι τοῖα μ. APl. 16.183.

data.quote: μή τι σὺ ταῦτα διείρεο μηδὲ μετάλλα
ἕταροι δὲ κατέκταθεν, οὓς σὺ μεταλλᾷς

children.definition: ask one about a thing, ask him a question, τοῦτο δέ τοι ἐρέω, ὅ μʼ ἀνείρεαι ἠδὲ μεταλλᾷς Il. 3.177; ἔπος ἄλλο μ. καὶ ἐρέσθαι Νέστορα Od. 3.243. (Poet. word, also in late Prose, POxy. 237 vii 40 (ii A.D.), Them. Or. 22.266c: expld. by Gramm. as search after other things ( μετὰ ἄλλα), Eust. 148.10, etc., but this is very dub.)

data.quote: τοῦτο δέ τοι ἐρέω, ὅ μʼ ἀνείρεαι ἠδὲ μεταλλᾷς
ἔπος ἄλλο μ. καὶ ἐρέσθαι Νέστορα

children.definition: searching for metals and the like, mining, Pl. Criti. 114e, Lg. 842d (pl.), Str. 3.2.9, al.: in pl., concrete, mines, Id. 3.2.3.
mining operations in a siege, D.S. 16.74.
underground channel, Pl. Lg. 761c.
μεγαλόδωρος ἡ μ. τοῦ ἀληθοῦς Max.Tyr. 17.2.
minerals, σίδηρος καὶ χαλκὸς καὶ πάντα τὰ μ. Pl. Lg. 678d.

data.quote: σίδηρος καὶ χαλκὸς καὶ πάντα τὰ μ.

children.definition: Lys. Fr. 89 S., Pl. Lg. 678d, IG 2.3260b: in pl., Max.Tyr. 6.2 (cj.), 17.2; title of plays by Pherecrates and Nicomachus.

children.label: II
children.definition: ant, Hsch.

definition: μετάλλευσις, εως, ἡ, v.l. for μεταλλεία, Palaeph. 9: in pl.,

children.definition: mining operations, Ph. Bel. 91.19.
one who searches for metals or water, miner, Str. 9.2.18, 15.1.30, Man. 4.259.
metallurgist, Procl. Par.Ptol. 250 (pl.).
skilled in searching for metals: ἡ -κή (sc. τέχνη) the art of mining, Arist. Pol. 1258b31, Oec. 1343a27; μ. ἐργασία PSI 8.962B. 28 (ii A. D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: of or consisting of mines, κτῆμα Pl. Lg. 847d.
to be got by mining, τὰ μ., opp. τὰ ὀρυκτά, Arist. Mete. 378a21, cf. Gal. 12.166.
get by mining, χαλκόν LXX De. 8.9; χρυσοῖο γενέθλην D.P. 1114:— Pass., to be got by mining, of metals, Pl. Plt. 288d, Arist. Mete. 378a27, Pol. 1258b32.

mine, οἱ μεταλλεύοντες Ph. Bel. 99.13, D.S. 5.37, Luc. Cont. 11; Λαμψακηνοῖς μ. work in mines for the L., Polyaen. 2.1.26 (- ηνοί codd., i.e. condemn to labour in mines): c. acc. cogn., πᾶν μεταλλεύων γνύθος Lyc. 485.
carry on mining operations, of besiegers, D.S. 18.70: also c. acc. cogn., μ. τὰς ὑπονόμους σήραγγας D.H. 4.44, cf. Polyaen. 7.11.5.
undermine, τείχη J. AJ 17.10.3.
explore, AP 6.302 ( Leon.), Nic. Th. 672; μ. τὴν ἔρευναν Porph. Marc. 26.

children.label: II
children.definition: pervert, ῥεμβασμὸς ἐπιθυμίας μ. νοῦν ἄκακον LXX Wi. 4.12:— Pass., to be converted, εἰς πάντα ib. 16.25.
to be condemned to hard labour in mines, Cod.Just. 11.41.7.

of or for mines, νόμος D. 37.35; δίκαι ib. 37, Arist. Ath. 59.5; ἐργασίαι D.S. 5.36; σκεῦος Hsch. s.v. ξοΐς: - κός, ὁ, miner, PLond. 1.324.6 (ii A. D.): - κή (sc. τέχνη), ἡ, art of mining, Phld. Oec. p.64 J., Alex.Aphr. in Metaph. 353.18.

children.label: II
children.definition: possessing a knowledge of metals, Ptol. Tetr. 13, Procl. Par.Ptol. 20.
metallic, φάρμακα Gal. 12.208; τὰ μ. Dsc. Praef. 1, Plu. QConv. 2.663c, Meges ap. Orib. 44.24.2; μ. τάλαντα, of the heavy Egyptian talents, Wilcken Chr. 321.18 (ii A. D.).

definition: μεταλλίτης [ ῑ], ου, ὁ, fem. μεταλλ-ῖτις, ιδος,

children.definition: containing minerals, γῆ Hsch.
change, Aristeas 17 ( Pass.), Ph. 1.241, Herm. ap. Stob. 1.49.69 ( Pass.), Syn.Alch. p.59 B., St.Byz. s.v. Ἀζανοί ( Pass.).
change, Plot. 3.6.11.

mine, quarry, ἁλὸς μέταλλον salt- pit, salt- mine, Hdt. 4.185; μ. τετμημένον Hyp. Eux. 35; μ. παλαιὸν ἀνασάξιμον IG 2(2).1582.56: mostly in pl., χρύσεα καὶ ἀργύρεα μέταλλα gold and silver mines, Hdt. 3.57; τὰ ἀργύρεια μ., at Laurium, Th. 2.55; μέταλλα (alone) silver mines, X. Vect. 4.4; μαρμάρου μ. marble quarries, Str. 9.1.23.
mine in siege-operations, πολιορκεῖν διὰ τῶν μ. Plb. 16.11.2, al.
work, οὐδʼ ἐν τοῖς ἀργυρείοις [ἐστί] μοι μ. Alciphr. 1.36.

data.quote: οὐδʼ ἐν τοῖς ἀργυρείοις [ἐστί] μοι μ.

children.label: II
children.definition: mineral, metal, Sammelb. 4313 (i/ii A. D.), Ruf. ap. Orib. 5.3.21, Nonn. D. 11.26, Agath. 5.9, AP 7.363. (On the etym. cf. μεταλλάω.)
work mines, D.S. 5.36.
dig from a mine, Dsc. 5.74 ( Pass.).
change oneʼs mind, Sch. E. Hec. 857.
secondary list, POxy. 515.7 (ii A. D.).
between the breasts, ἔβαλε στῆθος μεταμάζιον Il. 5.19; τὸ μ. space between the breasts, Anacreont. 16.30.
Phlp. in Ph. 796.7.
search after, chase, ἄγραν Pi. N. 3.81.
learn differently, μ. γλῶσσαν unlearn one language and learn another instead, Hdt. 1.57, cf. Paus. l.c.; μ. ὕμνον learn a new strain, A. Ag. 709 (lyr.).
unlearn, τὴν ἐλευθερίαν Aeschin. 3.157; τοῦ μεταμανθάνοντος (sc. ψευδῆ δόξαν) Pl. R. 413a.
learn better, Ar. Pl. 924; εἰ γέρων ἄνθρωπος μεταμαθήσει Luc. l.c.; opp. μανθάνειν ἐξ ἀρχῆς, Arist. Pol. 1289a4.
exchange, change, ἐσλὸν πήματος good for ill, Pi. O. 12.12; [ οἱ ἐχῖνοι] μ. τὰς ὀπάς Arist. HA 612b6.
change to another form, ἐκ βοὸς . . μετάμειβε γυναῖκα Mosch. 2.52; μ. φρένα Nonn. D. 4.182.
remove, τινὰ Λαμνόθεν dub. cj. in Pi. P. 1.52; γᾶν τέκνων τέκνοις μ. hand down land to childrenʼs children, E. HF 796 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., change oneʼs condition, ἐκ προτέρων μεταμειψάμενοι καμάτων having escaped from . . , Pi. P. 3.96: abs., μεταμειβόμενοι ἐναλλάξ in turns, Id. N. 10.55.
μεταμείβεσθαί τινί τι to change one thing for another, E. Ph. 831 (lyr.).
exchange: alteration, Sch.rec. A. Pr. 669.

definition: μεταμέλει, impf. μετέμελε: fut. - μελήσει: aor. μετεμέλησε: ( μέλω):

children.label: I
children.definition: it repents me, rues me:—Constr.:
ὑμῖν μεταμελησάτω τῶν πεπραγμένων Lys. 30.30, cf. Pl. Phdr. 231a, X. Cyr. 8.3.32.

part. agreeing with the dat. pers., μετεμέλησέ οἱ τὸν Ἑλλήσποντον μαστιγώσαντι it repented him of having scourged it, Hdt. 7.54, cf. 1.130, 3.140, Antipho 5.91; οὔτε μοι μεταμέλει οὕτως ἀπολογησαμένῳ I do not regret having thus defended myself, Pl. Ap. 38e; also μ. μοι ὅτι . . X. Cyr. 5.3.6.

μ. τινί it repents one, Ar. Pl. 358, Antipho 5.94, Lys. 16.2: also without a dat., ξυνέβη ὑμῖν πεισθῆναι μὲν ἀκεραίοις μεταμέλειν δὲ κακουμένοις to repent when in distress, Th. 2.61; μεταλαμβάνειν ταὐτὰ καὶ μεταμέλειν ἐν ταῖς πράξεσιν Pl. Prt. 356d.

data.quote: μεταλαμβάνειν ταὐτὰ καὶ μεταμέλειν ἐν ταῖς πράξεσιν

children.definition: part. neut. μεταμέλον abs., since it repented him, τῶν ἀνηλωμένων αὐτοῖς μ. Isoc. 18.60, cf. Pl. Phd. 114a.

children.label: II
children.definition: cause repentance or sorrow, τῷ Ἀρίστωνι τὸ εἰρημένον μετέμελε Hdt. 6.63; τοῖσι . . ἡγεομένοισι τὰ πεπρηγμένα μετέμελε οὐδέν Id. 9.1; ὡς αὐτοῖσι μεταμέλῃ πόνος A. Eu. 771 (nowh. else in Trag.); οἶμαι δέ σοι ταῦτα μεταμελήσειν Ar. Nu. 1114.—Cf. μεταμέλομαι.

data.quote: τοῖσι . . ἡγεομένοισι τὰ πεπρηγμένα μετέμελε οὐδέν

definition: μεταμέλεια, Ion. -ίη Ps.- Hdt. Vit.Hom. 19: ἡ:—

children.definition: change of purpose, regret, repentance, μεταμέλειαν λαμβάνει E. Fr. 1080.3; μεταμελείας λ. Th. 1.34; ἐπί τισι, περί τινος, Democr. 43, Th. 3.37; μόνη σιωπὴ μ. οὐ φέρει Men. 1105; ἐμπιμπλάναι τινὰ μεταμελείας Pl. Lg. 727c; μεταμελείας μεστή Id. R. 577e; μ. τοῦ πεπραγμένου γίγνεται Id. Lg. 866e; τὸ ἐν μ. Arist. EN 1110b19; ἐκ μεταμελείας Plb. 1.39.14; αὕτη σε ἡ μ. ἔχει X. Cyr. 5.3.7, cf. Polystr. p.9 W. (pl.), Phld. Ir. p.43 W. (pl.).
Hsch.
full of regrets, always repenting, Arist. EN 1150a21, Ptol. Tetr. 155.
repented of, Hsch. s.v. πεδάγρετον.
cunctatio, Gloss.

definition: μεταμέλομαι, rare exc. in pres. and impf.: fut. -μελήσομαι Phld. Rh. 2.16 S., also -μεληθήσομαι LXX Ps. 109(110).4, Sch. E. Ph. 899: aor. - εμελήθην Plb. 8.23.2, D.S. 19.75, later - ήσθην PThead. 51.15 (iv A. D.); also Ep. μετεμέμβλετο prob. in Panyas. in Et.Gen. s.v. μῦθος ( Coll.Alex. p.249 Powell): pf. -μεμέλημαι LXX 1 Ma. 11.10, Phld. Vit. p.34 J.:—

children.definition: feel repentance, regret:—Constr.:
part., μετεμέλοντο οὐ δεξάμενοι they repented that they had not . . , Th. 4.27, cf. 7.50; μ. ὅτι . . Id. 5.14; ὁ μεταμελόμενος Arist. EN 1110b23.
μεταμέλεσθαί τινι repent at a thing, D.S. 15.9; ἐπί τινι Id. 19.75; τινων Phalar. Ep. 43.
change oneʼs purpose or line of conduct, X. Cyr. 4.6.5, Plb. 4.50.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: fut. part., τὸ μεταμελησόμενον that which will cause regret, matter for future repentance, X. Mem. 2.6.23.

children.label: III
children.definition: μεταμέλεσθαι αὐτοῖς περὶ ὧν ἂν συμβουλεύσωνται Pl. Demod. 382d.:—the form μεταμελέομαι, censured by Thom.Mag. p.123R., occurs in Hp. Ep. 27.

data.quote: μεταμέλεσθαι αὐτοῖς περὶ ὧν ἂν συμβουλεύσωνται

children.definition: repentance, regret, Th. 7.55, Conon 23.3, Themist. Ep. 4.1, J. AJ 19.4.4, Chor. p.214 B. [35.2.31]; ἀποθανὼν ὁ δίκαιος ἔλιπε μετάμελον LXX Pr. 11.3.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adj. μετάμελος, ον, repenting, πόλις ταῖς διαδιδομέναις φήμαις μετάμελος οὖσα D.S. 25.11.

data.quote: πόλις ταῖς διαδιδομέναις φήμαις μετάμελος οὖσα

children.definition: sing or dance among, τισι h.Ap. 197.
Hsch. μεταμίξ, Adv. mixedly, Id.
mix among, Od. 18.310, Hp. Morb. 2.45: fut. μεταμείξω, κτήματα . . τοῖσιν Ὀδυσσῆος μεταμείξομεν Od. 22.221.
sublet, PTeb. 105.31 (ii B. C.), POxy. 101.48 (ii A. D.): — Pass., PTeb. 61 ( b). 35 (ii B. C.).

transform, Gal. 19.479; ἑαυτὸν εἴς τι Ael. VH 1.1; disguise, ἑαυτόν App. BC 4.41:—mostly in Pass., to be transformed, Ep.Rom. 12.2, Plu. Adul. 2.52d, Luc. Asin. 11; εἰς θηρίων ἰδέαν D.S. 4.81; εἰς Ἀπόλλωνα Ph. 2.559; εἰς ἰχθύν Ath. 8.334c; ἀπὸ δόξης εἰς δόξαν 2 Ep.Cor. 3.18; to be transfigured, Ev.Matt. 17.2, etc.

transformation, Str. 1.2.11 (pl.), Hierocl. p.21 A., Luc. Salt. 57, Halc. 1 tit., Gal. 5.193, App. BC 4.42, Ant. Diog. 13 (pl.); τούτοις (sc. φυτοῖς) ἐμφύεται ψυχὴ κατὰ τὴν μ. Porph. Abst. 1.6; μεταμορφώσεων συναγωγή, title of work by Antoninus Liberalis.
transplant, Hsch.: Subst. μεταμόσχ-ευσις, εως, ἡ, Gloss.

clothe in a new dress, εἱμαρμένη -ίσχουσα τὰς ψυχάς Plu. fr 200.25 Sandbach:—more freq. in Med., put on a different dress, δουλείαν -ισχόμενος putting on the new dress of slavery, Pl. R. 569c; μ. τὸν βίον Procop. Arc. 16; ψυχήν Aen.Gaz. Thphr. p.10 B.: abs., change oneʼs dress, ἐὰν μεταμπίσχηται Aristid. 2.207 J.; cf. sq. [μεταμφιάζω]
be fabulously identified with, εἰς τὸν ἄνεμον Sch. D.P. 425.

definition: μεταμφιάζω (later μεταμφι-έζω Plu. Alex. fort. 2.340e, Luc. Nec. 16: fut. - έσω Max.Tyr. 21.1 [15.1.d]),

children.definition: change the dress of another, strip off his dress, τινα Plu. and Luc. ll.cc.; τὰ τοῦ πλησίον Max.Tyr. l.c.: c. dupl. acc., τὸ λαμπρὸν σχῆμα μ. τινά Hld. 2.21: metaph., change, τι εἴς τι AP 6.165 ( Phal.):— Med., take off oneʼs own dress, τὴν βασιλικὴν ἐσθῆτα μεταμφιασαμένη v.l. in Phylarch. 30 J. (cf. sq. [μεταμφιέννυμι]); πορφυρίδα μεταμφιάσομαι Luc. Herm. 86 codd.; ἀποδυσάμενος τὸν Πυθαγόραν τίνα μετημφιάσω μετʼ αὐτόν; what body didst thou assume after him? Id. Gall. 19; μ. τὴν τύχην, τὸν βίον, Vett.Val. 131.8, Procop. Arc. 17.

definition: μεταμφιέννυμι (also μεταμφι-εννύω Plu. Cupid. 2.528b), = foreg., metaph., D.L. 7.25:— Med.,

children.definition: take off oneʼs own dress, Phylarch. 30 J. (cf. foreg.); put on another dress, Plu. Nic. 3; μ. τὴν Ῥωμαίαν στολήν Hdn. 5.5.5; ψυχὴ μ. πολλὰ σώματα D.L. 3.67; τινι change clothes with . . , Theopomp.Hist. 89a: metaph., κυνῶν μ. βίον Phld. Sto. 339.8.

definition: μεταμώλιος, ον, dub. l. for sq.

children.label: II
children.definition: Hsch.

vain, idle, μ. νήματα vainly-woven, Od. 2.98; μεταμώνια βάζεις talkest idly, 18.332; τὰ δὲ πάντα θεοὶ μ. θεῖεν may the gods give all that to the winds, Il. 4.363; ψεύδη μ. Pi. O. 12.6; μ. θηρεύω Id. P. 3.23; τὰ δʼ οὐκ ἄρʼ ἔμελλε θεὸς μ. θήσειν Theoc. 22.181. —Used by Hom. only in neut. pl.: the etym. is dub., cf. μωνιή, μωνιόν; but later Poets apptly. connected the word with ἄνεμος (as if for μετανεμώνιος) ; κονία μεταμώνιος ἀέρθη borne by the wind, on high, Simon. 16; ἐς κόρακας βαδιεῖ μεταμώνιος Ar. Pax 117, ubi v. Sch.:— μεταμώλιος is v.l. in several passages; cf. ἀνεμώλιος.

data.quote: τὰ δʼ οὐκ ἄρʼ ἔμελλε θεὸς μ. θήσειν

children.definition: repent of, c. gen., Αἴας μετανεγνώσθη θυμοῦ ( Herm. for θυμὸν) . . μεγάλων τε νεικέων S. Aj. 717 (lyr.).
dwell with, τισι to be read metri gr. for μεταναίεται in h.Cer. 87.
one who dwells with, Hes. Th. 401.
change by persuasion, in Pass., Hsch. s.v. μετανεγνώ<σ>θη.
migration, in pl., Hp. Aër. 20, Th. 1.2, 2.16, X. Mem. 3.5.12, Str. 3.4.19: sg., of the soul, Ph. 1.91: metaph., μεταναστάσεις τῆς γνώμης Procop. Arc. 22.
devastated by migrations, ἡ Ἑλλὰς οὐχ ὑπʼ ἀνθρώπων μόνον γινομένη μ. Ocell. 3.5.

data.quote: ἡ Ἑλλὰς οὐχ ὑπʼ ἀνθρώπων μόνον γινομένη μ.

children.label: II
children.definition: having departed, πατέρων μετανάστατος ψυχή Ph. 1.513.
remove, LXX Ps. 51(52).5, Ph. 1.299:— Med., depart, flee, LXX Ps. 10(11).1.
Act., = Med., ib. 61(62).6, Str. Chr. 7.5.

definition: μετανάστης, ου, ὁ, ( μεταναστῆναι, cf. ὑπερανάστης)

children.definition: one who has left his home, wanderer, migrant, commonly as a term of reproach, ἀτίμητος μ. Il. 9.648; μοῦνοι οὐ μετανάσται Ἑλλήνων, of the Athenians, Hdt. 7.161; fugitive, POxy. 487.18 (ii A. D.), PTeb. 439 (ii A. D.); μ. γενόμενοι ὑπὸ ἐθνῶν Prisc. p.341 D. (cf. μετανίσταντο ibid.): c. gen., ἀρετῆς μ. from virtue, Ph. 1.415, cf. 477; πάτρης μ. Man. 2.420.

children.label: II
children.definition: wandering, of the planets, opp. the fixed stars, Arat. 457:—hence fem. μετανάστις, ψυχὴ σώματος μ. a fugitive from . . , Ph. 2.462; also μετανάστρια, σκοπέλων μ. πέρδιξ AP 7.204 ( Agath.).
wandering, Nonn. D. 1.110; Νύμφαι AP 9.814.
to be diverted from their proper use, of monies, OGI 483.52 ( Pergam., ii A. D.).
εὐνήν Musae. 205, Nonn. D. 14.89.
to be transported, POxy. 1049.1 (ii A. D.).
change its colour, χλαμὺς κατὰ τὴν ἶριν μ. Philostr. Im. 1.10, cf. Aristaenet. 1.11.

cup drunk after washing the hands at the end of meals, δέξαι τηνδὶ μ. τῆς Ὑγιείας Call.Com. 6, cf. Antiph. 149; μ. τῆς Ὑγιείας ἔγχεον Nicostr.Com. 3; μ. μεστὴν Διὸς Σωτῆρος Diph. 69:—also μετάνιπτρον, τό, δαίμονος ἀγαθοῦ μ. Antiph. 137.
pass over, Ἠέλιος μετενίσετο βουλυτόνδε Il. 16.779, Od. 9.58: c. acc., pass into, enter, Καρκίνον ἠέλιος μ. AP 9.384.13.
flow into another, A.R. 4.628.

children.label: II
children.definition: pursue, E. Tr. 131 (anap.); win, get possession of, [ πλοῦτον] Pi. P. 5.8; go in quest of, A.R. 1.1245, cf. E. Hyps.Fr. (3) 1 iii 37 (lyr., - νεισεται Pap.).
remove from his or their country, Plb. 3.5.5; εἰς ἄλλας πόλεις Id. 9.26.7.
remove, i.e. avert, τὰ χείριστα Phld. D. 1.19.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., c. aor. 2 et pf. Act., remove, migrate, Th. 1.12, 3.114, S. OC 175 (anap.), Ph. 1.514, POxy. 44.9 (i A. D.); ἐς χῶρον Hdt. 9.51, cf. D.S. 4.85; ἐκ τῶν ἄνω τόπων Id. 1.37; πρός τινας Ph. 2.25; μ. Πελοποννήσου emigrate from . . , Conon 47.1.
perceive afterwards or too late, opp. προνοέω, Epich. [280]; opp. προβουλεύομαι, Democr. 66; concur subsequently, τισι BGU 747 i 11 (ii A. D.).
change oneʼs mind or purpose, Pl. Euthd. 279c, Men. Epit. 72; μ. μὴ οὔτε . . τῶν χαλεπῶν ἔργων ᾖ τὸ . . ἄρχειν change oneʼs opinion and think that it is not . . , X. Cyr. 1.1.3.

repent, Antipho 2.4.12; ἐν τοῖς ἀνηκέστοις Id. 5.91: freq. in LXX and NT, Si.48.15, al.; ἀπὸ τῆς κακίας Act.Ap. 8.22; ἐκ τῶν ἔργων Apoc. 9.20; ἐπὶ τῇ ἀκαθαρσίᾳ 2 Ep.Cor. 12.21, cf. OGI 751.9 ( Amblada, ii B. C.); ἐπί τινι Luc. Salt. 84, etc.; περί τινων Plu. Galb. 6; τοῖς πεπραγμένοις Id. Agis 19: c. part., μ. γενόμενος Ἕλλην Luc. Am. 36.
repent of, τὴν ἄφιξιν J. BJ 4.4.5.
ultimate concept, Dam. Pr. 117.
given to repentance, Max.Tyr. 11.3.

change of mind or heart, repentance, regret, Batr. 70, Th. 3.36, Philem. 198, Plb. 4.66.7, LXX Pr. 14.15, Aristeas 188, Plu. QConv. 2.712c (pl.), etc.; ἀνίατος γὰρ τῶν τοιούτων μ. Antipho 2.4.12; γαμεῖν ὁ μέλλων εἰς μ. ἔρχεται Men. Mon. 91; ἡ εἰς τὸν θεὸν μ. Act.Ap. 20.21; μ. ἀπὸ νεκρῶν ἔργων Ep.Hebr. 6.1.

data.quote: γαμεῖν ὁ μέλλων εἰς μ. ἔρχεται

children.label: II
children.definition: afterthought, correction, Rutil. 1.16.
draw from one vessel into another, εἰς ἀγγεῖα Gp. 9.19.8: metaph., of Τύχη, AP 9.180 ( Pall.).
raw silk, Procop. Arc. 25, Lyd. Mag. 2.4, etc. (The etym. is unknown: an earlier Latin form mataxa in Lucil. 1192, Vitr. 7.3.2 in the sense of ‘floss’, ‘tow’.)
purple silk, Edict.Diocl. 24.1a,13.
silk-merchant, Just. Nov.App. 5.

definition: μετάξιον, τό, Dim. of μέταξα, Sch. E. Hec. 447.

children.definition: Ps.-Callisth. 3.7.

definition: μεταξύ (late form μετοξύ PLond. 2.177.11 (i A.D.), etc.), Adv., ( μετά, ξύν) prop.

children.definition: in the midst: hence,

children.label: I
children.definition: Adv.,

betwixt, between, once in Hom., Il. 1.156, cf. h.Merc. 159, etc.: with Art., τὸ μ. Hdt. 2.8, Ar. Av. 551; ἐν τούτῳ μ. Th. 4.25; νεάτης τε καὶ ὑπάτης καὶ μέσης καὶ εἰ ἄλλα ἄττα μ. τυγχάνει ὄντα Pl. R. 443d; αὐχένα μ. τιθέντες Id. Ti. 69e: metaph., φίλος ἢ ἐχθρὸς ἢ μ. Arist. Rh. 1376a30.

data.quote: νεάτης τε καὶ ὑπάτης καὶ μέσης καὶ εἰ ἄλλα ἄττα μ. τυγχάνει ὄντα

children.definition: between-whiles, meanwhile, Hdt. 4.155, S. Fr. 225, Pl. Ly. 207d, etc.; τὰ μ. the intervening events, Isoc. 12.201: freq. c. pres. part., μ. ὀρύσσων ἐπαύσατο in the midst of his digging, Hdt. 2.158; ἐπελαυνόντων . . μ. Id. 4.129; μ. θύων Ar. Ra. 1242; μ. πίνων Eup. 351.5; μ. πορευομένους X. Cyr. 8.8.11, cf. Pl. Ly. 207b, etc.; ἐξαναστάντες μ. δειπνοῦντες in the middle of supper, D. 18.169; ἀπαγχομένη μ. κατεκλίθη ( κατεκωλύθη Blass), i.e. in the interval between this and reviving, And. 1.125: freq. with Verbs of speaking, λέγοντα μ. in the middle of my discourse, Pl. Ap. 40b, cf. Euthd. 275e, R. 336b: without part., μ. ὑπολαβεῖν to interrupt, X. An. 3.1.26; μ. τὸν λόγον καταλύομεν Pl. Grg. 505c; μ. διαλῦσαι τὴν συνουσίαν Id. Prt. 336e; ἐν τῷ μ. (sc. χρόνῳ) X. Smp. 1.14: with χρόνῳ, D. 30.17.

children.label: b
children.definition: Adv.), after, afterwards, τὸ μ. σάββατον the next Sabbath, Act.Ap. 13.42; οἱ μ. τούτων βασιλεῖς the kings who followed them, J. BJ 5.4.2; οἱ μ. τούτων, = Lat. posteri eorum, IG 14.1913.
τὰ μ. intermediate, i.e. neither good nor bad, Pl. Grg. 468a.
ὅσον τὸ μ. how great is the difference, Timocl. 22.1.
neuter gender, Arist. SE 166b12, Po. 1458a17.

children.label: II
children.definition: between, Hdt. 1.6, 7.85, Th. 1.118, 4.42, etc.; μ. σοφίας καὶ ἀμαθίας Pl. Smp. 202a; μ. τούτοιν ἀμφοῖν ἐν μέσῳ ὄν Id. R. 583c; αἱ μ. τῶν λόγων διηγήσεις the explanations between the speeches, Id. Tht. 143c; but μ. τῶν λόγων if I may interrupt the argument, Id. Phdr. 230a; μ. τῶν βασιλέων among kings, Plu. Apophth.reg. 2.177c; between parties to an agreement, τιμὴ ἡ συμφωνηθεῖσα μ. τινῶν BGU 316.15 (iv A. D.); τὰ μ. σύμφωνα the terms agreed between the parties, POxy. 914.8 (v A.D.): sts. one of the extremes is omitted, ἄνωθεν τῶν Θυεστείων ῥακῶν μ. τῶν Ἰνοῦς Ar. Ach. 434; ἢ ἐναντίοις οὖσιν ἢ μ. Arist. GC 319b12; ἦν συμφέρον ὡς πλεῖστον τὸν μ. χρόνον γενέσθαι τῶν ὅρκων D. 18.26.

data.quote: μ. τούτοιν ἀμφοῖν ἐν μέσῳ ὄν
ἄνωθεν τῶν Θυεστείων ῥακῶν μ. τῶν Ἰνοῦς
ἦν συμφέρον ὡς πλεῖστον τὸν μ. χρόνον γενέσθαι τῶν ὅρκων

children.label: b
children.definition: μ. θύρας in the opening of the door, Sor. 1.119.

ὁ μ. τῆς δίκης τε καὶ τοῦ θανάτου [χρόνος] Pl. Phd. 58c, cf. E. Hec. 437; τὰ μ. τούτου meanwhile, S. OC 291: as a Prep., it may either precede or follow its case, but more freq. precedes, cf. Pl. Phd. 71a and b.
use of digressions, Theon Prog. 4 (pl.), Men.Prot. p.28 D., Olymp. in Mete. 41.23.
middle position, A.D. Conj. 221.5.
mean, = μεσότης, Theol.Ar. 50 (pl.).

children.label: II
children.definition: interval, διάστημά ἐστι δυοῖν φθόγγων μ. Nicom. Harm. 12, cf. 6 (pl.), S.E. M. 5.78 (pl.).
interval, Cat.Cod.Astr. 5(1).192.
of silk, ὕφασμα Hdn. Epim. 125.
POxy. 237 vii 23 (ii A.D.).

definition: μεταπαιδαγωγέω, f.l. for παραπαιδ- in Luc. Nigr. 12.

children.definition: educate differently, LXX 4 Ma. 2.7 ( Pass.), Luc. Anach. 17:— Pass., of a substance, acquire a fresh tendency, Pall. in Hp. 2.104 D.
play, sport, τῶν ἐφήβων πρὸς ἀλλήλους OGI 764.27 ( Pergam., ii B. C.).
rush, dart to and fro, A.R. 3.1266.
hand down, τῷ μεθʼ ἑαυτὸν ἱερεῖ τι BCH 44.79d2 ( Lagina); <καθ>άπερ μυστήρια Iamb. VP 32.226; transfer, IG 14.759.22 ( Naples), PMag.Par. 1.501: Astrol., yield up the χρονοκρατορία, Vett.Val. 163.25.
handing over of funds, IGRom. 4.948.10 ( Chios).

receive a thing from another, οἱ παρʼ ἐμοῦ -λημψόμενοι my successors in title, PAmh. 2.68.23 (i A. D.), cf. IG 42(1).88.19 ( Epid., ii A.D.), PMag.Par. 1.525, Vett.Val. 219.3; take over an office, BGU 1192.8 (i B.C.).
change about, interchange, in Pass., Hero *Geom. 3.25.
transfer in an account, prob. in PFlor. 92.6 (i A.D.).
rest between-whiles, μεταπαυόμενοι δὲ μάχοντο Il. 17.373.

children.label: II
children.definition: cease from, ὅθι λαρὸν ὕδωρ -παύεται ἅλμης Opp. H. 1.115.
rest between-whiles, πολέμοιο from war, Il. 19.201.
change a manʼs persuasion, Ar. Ach. 626, Lys. 9.7, D. 18.228:— Pass., to be persuaded to change, Pl. R. 413b, X. HG 7.1.14, Isoc. 3.47, D. Prooem. 28.
try in a different way, Ar. Ec. 217.
pierce through again, Antyll. (?) ap. Orib. 45.18.7, Sor. 2.62.
open to persuasion, Pl. Ti. 51e; μ. ὑπὸ λόγου Id. Def. 414c.
to be sent for, Th. 6.25.
sent for, Hdt. 8.67, Th. 6.29, X. An. 1.4.3, Phld. Mus. p.86 K., etc.; μ. δικαστήρια, of the federal circuit-courts of the Lycian league, OGI 556.14 (i B. C.), IGRom. 3.680.7 (i A. D.).
send after or for, Ἀγαμέμνονος πέμψαντος . . μέτα having sent for thee, E. Hec. 504; παρʼ Εὐχαρίδου τρεῖς ἄγλιθας μετέπεμψα Ar. V. 680.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., μεταπέμπεσθαί τινα summon, Hdt. 1.41, al., Ar. Ach. 1087, al., Antipho 1.15, etc.; of things, send for, σῖτον OGI 56.17 ( Canopus, iii B.C.), etc.: Th. uses Act. and Med. indifferently, cf. 1.112, 4.30, 6.52, with 2.29, 5.82:— Pass., μεταπεμφθῆναι to be sent for, D. 28.14, cf. Pl. Prt. 319b; ἐξ Ἀθηνῶν μεταπεπέμφθαι Phld. Mus. p.28 K.
a sending for, summons, Pl. Ep. 338b, Str. 12.3.24, Nic.Dam. 130.30 J. (pl.), Plu. Alex. 33.
move as in the game of draughts, τινα dub. in Pl.Com. 124:— Pass., Pl. Min. 316c.
fly to another place, fly away, ἀπὸ . . εἰς . . Luc. Hist.Conscr. 50.
transfer to another place, in Med., πρὸς τὰ δένδρα τὴν καλιάν transfer its nest to the trees instead, D.Chr. 72.14.
leap from one place to another, hop or spring about, ἀπʼ ἄλλου πρὸς ἕτερον ἀκρεμόνα Agatharch. 51, cf. Luc. Gall. 1, Syr.D. 36, Gal. UP 10.12: metaph., S.E. M. 9.97.

children.label: II
children.definition: leap among, τισι App. Hann. 23.
leaping from one place to another, Plu. QConv. 2.739c.
drink after, Hp. Acut. 56, in Pass., opp. προπίνομαι.
give to drink afterwards, Hp. Morb. 2.65.
sell after or again, Phryn. PS p.88 B.

definition: μεταπίπτω, used as Pass. of μεταβάλλω,

children.definition: fall differently, undergo a change,

children.label: a
children.definition: Heraclit. 88, Meliss. 8, Pl. Cra. 440a, etc.; πολλαχῶς μ. Diog.Apoll. 2; μ. τὸ εἶδος Hdt. 6.61; μ. εἰς ἄλλο εἶδος Pl. Cra. 440b; ἐκ γυναικὸς ἐς ὄρνεον Luc. Philops. 2: Gramm., τὸ ᾱ μ. εἰς τὸ ο̄ A.D. Adv. 188.25; fall into disrepair, PSI 4.444.3 (iii B. C.).

data.quote: τὸ ᾱ μ. εἰς τὸ ο̄

children.label: b
children.definition: change oneʼs opinion suddenly, τὸν ὁμόθεν πεφυκότα στέργων μετέπεσον E. IA 502; ἐξ ἐχθίστου μ. Ar. Av. 627: abs., Isoc. 9.50, Plb. 5.49.7, PRyl. 118.4 (i B. C.); also μ. εἰς τἀναντία τῆς γνώμης Plb. 21.7.7.

migrate, be transferred, Arist. Mete. 360b18, al.; of votes, εἰ τριάκοντα μόναι μετέπεσον τῶν ψήφων Pl. Ap. 36a, cf. Aeschin. 3.252; but ὀστράκου μεταπεσόντος on the fall of the sherd with the other side uppermost, prov., of a sudden change (borrowed from the game ὀστρακίνδα), Pl. Phdr. 241b, cf. Sch.

data.quote: εἰ τριάκοντα μόναι μετέπεσον τῶν ψήφων

children.definition: μεταπίπτοντος δαίμονος E. Alc. 913 (anap.); μ. ἄνω κάτω Pl. Grg. 493a; τοὐναντίον μεταπέπτωκεν Id. Tht. 162d; τὰ μὲν [πάθη] ταχὺ μεταπίπτειν εἴθισται D. 26.18; τὸ τῆς τύχης γὰρ ῥεῦμα μ. ταχύ Men. Georg.Fr. 2; freq. of political changes, undergo revolution, Th. 8.68, Pl. Ep. 325a; μετεπεπτώκει τὰ πράγματα a revolution had taken place, Lys. 20.14; ἡ Ῥωμαίων δυναστεία μετέπεσεν εἰς μοναρχίαν Hdn. 1.1.4; also ἀρχὴ -πεσοῦσα εἰς ἄνδρα ἐξ ἀσήμου γένους Id. 2.3.1: generally, change for the worse, ἐξ εὐπορίης εἰς πενίην Democr. 101; εἰς δουλείαν Lycurg. 50; ἐξ εὐτυχίας εἰς δυστυχίαν Arist. Po. 1453a2; also, for the better, μ. ἐκ τοῦ κακῶς πράττειν Lycurg. 60; μεταπέσοι βελτίονα E. Ion 412; τοῦ πυκνὰ μεταπίπτοντος κριτηρίου Epicur. Fr. 230; of a person, to be variable, μ. καὶ μεταρριπίζεσθαι Arr. Epict. 1.4.19.

data.quote: τὸ τῆς τύχης γὰρ ῥεῦμα μ. ταχύ
ἡ Ῥωμαίων δυναστεία μετέπεσεν εἰς μοναρχίαν
ἀρχὴ -πεσοῦσα εἰς ἄνδρα ἐξ ἀσήμου γένους

children.label: b
children.definition: μεταπίπτοντες λόγοι fallacies due to a change in meaning of terms, ib. 1.7.1; συλλογισμοὶ μ. ib. 2.17.27.

children.label: II
children.definition: fall from, fail of . . , εἰ ἡ γνῶσις τοῦ γνῶσις εἶναι μὴ μεταπίπτει Pl. Cra. 440a.

data.quote: εἰ ἡ γνῶσις τοῦ γνῶσις εἶναι μὴ μεταπίπτει

children.label: III
children.definition: to be transferred, εἴς τινα ἐξ ὀνόματός τινος Stud.Pal. 4.114.14 (ii A.D.).
metaplasm, the formation of cases of Nouns or tenses of Verbs from a non-existent nom. or pres., A.D. Adv. 183.22 (pl.), Choerob. in Theod. 1.377, Arc. 129.9.
mould differently, remodel, Pl. Ti. 92b, Iamb. Myst. 3.28; τι εἴς τι Pl. Ti. 50a (so in Med., AP 9.708 ( Phil.)); βίον μ. ἄλλοι ἄλλως Melinno ap. Stob. 3.7.12.
counterfeit, τὸ θεῖον νόμισμα Ph. 1.220.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be formed by metaplasm, A.D. Adv. 184.11, Arc. 129.6, Eust. 58.38.
changed in form, of forms used by Poets, Festus p.138 L.
change oneʼs sailing, sail on another tack, An.Ox. 3.219; Ion. μετα-πλώω Opp. H. 3.427.
the transformed, the deified, Hsch.
prospera navigatio, dub. in Gloss.
recover breath, καμάτοιο from . . , Opp. H. 5.314.
recovering of breath, gloss on μετάψυξις, Hsch.

alter the make of a thing, remodel, νόμους D. 18.121; πάντα ἐς τοὺς τρόπους τοὺς παραπλησίους μ. Hp. Fract. 26; εἰς γάμον ἀπὸ τῆς θυσίας μ. τὴν εὐωχίαν Hld. 5.29, cf. Porph. Antr. 36: abs., μεταποίησον re-compose the verse, Sol. 20.3:— Pass., -ποιεῖσθαι εἰς τὸ δέον A.D. Synt. 199.18.

data.quote: πάντα ἐς τοὺς τρόπους τοὺς παραπλησίους μ.
εἰς γάμον ἀπὸ τῆς θυσίας μ. τὴν εὐωχίαν

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., lay claim to, pretend to, c. gen. rei, e.g. ξυνέσεως, ἀρετῆς τι, Th. 1.140, 2.51; τέχνης Pl. Plt. 289e; οὐδέν σφι μετεὸν μεταποιεῦνται (sc. τοῦ ἐμπορίου) Hdt. 2.178.
change of ownership, POxy. 318 (i A.D.).
claiming, ἀρετῆς J. AJ 3.2.4; τῶν διπλῶν IG 14.1054; acquisition, Ph. 2.419.

children.label: II
children.definition: changing, alteration, Apollon. ap. Gal. 12.653, Antyll. ap. Orib. 7.7.7: also in Rhet., Hermog. Inv. 4.3.
one must alter, ἐπὶ τὸ χρηστότερον Philum. ap. Aët. 9.33.
punishing afterwards, δίκη Suid. s.v. ποωή.
Pl. Ep. 348d, Ael. VH 13.34.
in the midst of the sea, Hsch.
pursuing, Hsch.
go after, follow up, ἔχθραν Lys. 31.2; pursue, punish, τοὺς ἀποστήσαντας Plb. 1.88.9; ἀσέβειαν Id. 2.58.11, cf. J. AJ 6.13.4.
seek after, canvass for, ἀρχήν Plb. 10.4.2, cf. Πολέμων 1.30 ( Demetrias).
change, βουλήν, ἤθη, Procop. Goth. 4.34, Aed. 6.2; ῥεῖθρον, of a river, ib. 2.10.

children.label: II
children.definition: go from one place to another, migrate, Pl. Lg. 904c, PPetr. 3p.129 (iii B.C.), PRev.Laws 44.10 (iii B.C.).
one must drink afterwards, Hp. Acut. 63.
re-sale, Str. 5.3.7.
one who re-sells, Sch. Ptol. Tetr. 151, Suid. s.v. μετάβολοι.
distinguished among, c. dat. pl., δόμον . . μεταπρεπέʼ ἀθανάτοισι Il. 18.370.

distinguish oneself or be distinguished among, c. dat. pl., [ ταῦρος] βόεσσι μ. Il. 2.481, etc.: freq. (esp. in Il.) of heroes, μ. ἡρώεσσιν ib. 579; Τρώεσσι 13.175; ἱππεῦσι 11.720, cf. Hes. Th. 92 (tm.); συμποσίοισι μ. Phalaec. ap. Ath. 10.440d; ἐν πάντεσσι Orph. A. 806: c. dat. modi, ἔγχεϊ Τρωσὶ μεταπρέπω I am distinguished among the Trojans by the spear, Il. 16.835, cf. 596, Hes. Th. 377: so c. inf., μετέπρεπε Μυρμιδόνεσσιν ἔγχεϊ μάρνασθαι Il. 16.194, cf. Od. 18.2 (tm.): c. acc., μ. ἠϊθέοισιν εἶδος A.R. 2.784.
flee cowering to another place, seek refuge, A. Supp. 332.

change, Pl. Lg. 895b, etc.; τῶν πραγμάτων Arist. MM 1207b12; τὸ κατὰ μετάπτωσιν ἐνόχλημα Epicur. Fr. 154; ὁ βίος ἀδήλους τὰς μ. ἔχει Men. Mon. 581; εἰς ἄλληλα Str. 17.1.36: pl., OGI 335.128 (Pergam.); - σεις λημμάτων, λόγων, Arr. Epict. 1.7.20, 3.2.17; εἰ . . εἰς μ. ἔσται ὁ ἀγρός if it shall be transferred, CIG 3702 ( Mysia); ἡ ἐκ τύχης ἄνω καὶ κάτω μ. Ael. VH 2.29.

data.quote: ὁ βίος ἀδήλους τὰς μ. ἔχει
ἡ ἐκ τύχης ἄνω καὶ κάτω μ.

children.label: II
children.definition: change of party, πρός τινας Plb. 3.99.3; change of opinion, τοῦ πλήθους Phld. Rh. 2.17 S. (pl.).

children.label: III
children.definition: inflexion, μ. εἰς ἀριθμόν, πτῶσιν, A.D. Adv. 181.2: generally, change, μ. τοῦ ο̄ εἰς τὸ ᾱ Tryphoib. 174.4; ἐκ -πτώσεως A.D. Synt. 50.20.
liable to change: of the quantity of vowels, common, D.H. Comp. 14.
fickle, M.Ant. 11.10.
= foreg., ἐνέργειαι ἐν ὀλίγῳ μ. Plu. Virt.mor. 2.447a, cf. M.Ant. 5.10. Adv. - τως Arr. Epict. 2.22.8.
space between two towers, curtain, Th. 3.22, Lys. Fr. 97 S., IG 2(2).463.49, 22.1658, al., Ph. Bel. 80.11, J. BJ 3.5.2 (pl.).

definition: μεταπυργίς, ίδος, ἡ, = foreg., Ph. Bel. 81.23 (s. v.l.).

children.definition: PLond. 2.856.13 (i A.D.), SIG 884.20 ( Thisbe, iii A.D.):— Pass., GDI 2562.15 (Delph.).
divert a stream, metaph., Heraclit. All. 18.
counted among, ἀθανάτοισιν h.Hom. 26.6, cf. A.R. 1.205; in tmesi, v. ἀρίθμιος II.
Phryn. PS p.69 B.
divert a flux, εἰς τὰ ἐκτός [ Gal.] 14.744.
change in flux, Orib. Fr. 54.
Alex.Aphr. in Mete. 115.19.
flow differently: change to and fro, ebb and flow, ὥσπερ Εὔριπος Arist. EN 1167b7, cf. Aret. SD 2.1.

change from one side to the other, as from right to left, Pl. Tht. 193d: metaph., change sides, transfer oneʼs allegiance or affections, μ. πᾶν τὸ ἔθνος εἰς αὐτόν J. BJ 1.4.5; τὰ πράγματα μ. εἰς Μιθριδάτην Posidon. 36 J.:— Pass., μεταρρυῆναι εἰς παῖδα Philostr. VA 3.38, cf. VS 2.3.

data.quote: μ. πᾶν τὸ ἔθνος εἰς αὐτόν

children.definition: uproot, Nonn. D. 21.106.
fan into flame, Nonn. D. 2.408.

children.label: II
children.definition: blow about, in Pass., μ. ἅμα τισί Arr. Epict. 1.4.19.
toss from side to side, ἑωυτόν Hp. Epid. 7.10, cf. Thphr. Ign. 53.
turn upside down, πάντα μεταρρίπτει θεός Simon. 62 ( = Com.Adesp. 383); τὰ καλῶς πεπηγότα μ. D. 25.90.

children.label: II
children.definition: bring over, ἀπὸ τῆς Φιλίππου συμμαχίας πρὸς τὴν Ῥωμαίων Plb. 18.13.8, cf. 30.7.2, al.; μ. τὴν διάνοιαν ἐπί . . turn oneʼs mind to . . , Phld. Vit. p.17 J.

data.quote: ἀπὸ τῆς Φιλίππου συμμαχίας πρὸς τὴν Ῥωμαίων

children.definition: change of stream, reflux, τοῦ πνεύματος Arist. Mete. 367a28: pl., Plu. Def.orac. 2.433f, Gal. 16.540; also of light, Plot. 4.5.7.

definition: μεταρρυθμέω, = sq., dub. l. in Procop. Goth. 4.2.

children.definition: change the form or fashion of a thing, remodel, τὰ γράμματα Hdt. 5.58; πόρον A. Pers. 747; τὴν λέξιν Arist. Ph. 185b28; τὸ ἀμφίβολον τῆς προαιρέσεως εἰς βεβαιότητα Hierocl. in CA 2p.422M., cf. 19p.460M.:— Pass., have oneʼs form changed, Pl. Ti. 46a, Arist. Cael. 306b13.

data.quote: τὸ ἀμφίβολον τῆς προαιρέσεως εἰς βεβαιότητα

children.definition: reform, amend, X. Oec. 11.2, 3, Arist. EN 1179b16, Epicur. Nat. 82 G.; cure, τινὰ τῶν ἁμαρτημάτων Philostr. VA 1.13:— Pass., οὐδὲ μετερρύθμισθέ πω ib. 6.11.

children.label: II
children.definition: make in a different form, Pl. Ti. 91d ( Pass.).
alteration, prob. in Tz. ad Hes. Op. 42.
one must alter, correct, Sever. Clyst. 42.
pf. part. Pass. μετερρυθμωμένα, Hsch.; cf. μεταρυσμόω.
Gal. 16.56, 17(2).441, Alex.Aphr. in Mete. 69.28, Quaest. 99.2.
Ar. Nu. 319.
Pl. Sis. 389a.
Plu. Per. 5.
τὰ μ., title of work by Theophrastus, D.L. 5.44.

definition: μετάρσιος, Dor. πεδάρσιος, ον, also α, ον Hdt. 7.188, E. IT 27: ( μεταίρω):— Ion., poet., and in late Prose, as D.S. 3.51, Ocell. 3.1, J. AJ 6.9.4, Porph. ap. Eus. PE 3.9, for μετέωρος,

children.definition: raised from the ground, high in air, ἐσπᾶτο γὰρ πέδονδε καὶ μ. S. Tr. 786; μετάρσιοι χολαὶ διεσπείροντο melted into air, Id. Ant. 1009; λόγοι π. θρῴσκουσι are scattered to the winds, A. Ch. 846; ὑπὲρ πυρᾶς μ. ληφθεῖσʼ E. l.c.; μετάρσιον πλευρὰν ἔπαιρε Id. Hec. 499; μ. ἀναπτόμενος Ar. Av. 1382; ναῦς ἄρμενʼ ἔχοισα μ. having her sails hoisted, Theoc. 13.68; τὰ μ., = μετέωρα, the sky, heavens, Thphr. Ign. 3; but defined as τὰ μεταξὺ τοῦ αἰθέρος καὶ τῆς γῆς, opp. τὰ μετέωρα ( = τὰ ἐν οὐρανῷ), Ach.Tat. Intr. Arat. 32; πῦρ μ., opp. αἴθριον, D.H. 16.1; τὰ μ. also, birds of the air, J. l.c., cf. Porph. l.c.
on the high seas, ὅσας δὲ τῶν νεῶν μεταρσίας ἔλαβε [ὁ ἄνεμος] Hdt. l.c.; νῆσος μ. a floating island, Hecat. 305 J.
in suspense, ὅσσα Νεῖκος ἔρυκε μετάρσιον Emp. 35.9.

children.label: II
children.definition: high above this world, διὰ μούσας καὶ μ. ᾖξα E. Alc. 963 (lyr.); μ. ὕμνος IG 3.770: in bad sense, puffed up, elated, μ. τὴν ψυχὴν τηρεῖν Vett.Val. 340.13; ἡ πάρος ἀγλαΐῃσι μ. AP 5.272.1 ( Agath.).
airy, empty, κόμποι E. Andr. 1220 (lyr.).

children.label: III
children.definition: πνεῦμα Hp. Mul. 2.130; πνοὰς θερμὰς πνέω μετάρσιʼ, οὐ βέβαια (neut. pl. as Adv.) E. HF 1093.
puffed up, swollen, Hp. Mul. 2.110.
lift up, τὰς ὑστέρας Hp. Mul. 2.138:— Pass., νέφος μεταρσιωθέν Hdt. 8.65.
transplantation, Thphr. CP 1.4.2: ὀμμάτων μετάρσεσι is f.l. in Gal. Parv.Pil. 2.
Democr. 33.

definition: μεταρχή, Dor. -ά, ἡ, part of the νόμος κιθαρῳδικός, Poll. 4.66.
μετάρχιος, ὁ, name of month in Crete, Hemerolog.Flor.
μετασεύομαι, Ep. aor. μετέσσῠτο (v. infr.):— Pass.,

children.definition: go with or after, πολλαὶ δὲ μετεσσεύοντο γεραιαί Il. 6.296; rush towards or after, Ἀθηναίη δὲ μετέσσυτο 21.423: c. acc., μετέσσυτο ποιμένα λαῶν 23.389.

children.label: II
children.definition: rush back, πέλαγόσδε A.R. 4.1270.
prance among or after, Arat. 282.
transplant, Hsch. s.v. μεταβοθρεύοντες.

put into another dress ( σκευή), change the fashion of, transform, σαυτήν Ar. Ec. 499; τὰ ἅρματα εἰς τὸν αὐτὸν τρόπον X. Cyr. 6.2.8; μ. νόμον amend, Din. 1.42; put into a fresh shape, τὰς λέξεις D.H. Comp. 6.

data.quote: τὰ ἅρματα εἰς τὸν αὐτὸν τρόπον

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., exchange oneʼs equipment with another, App. Pun. 8; μ. εἰς τοὺς ὁπλίτας Jul. Or. 2.60a.
pack up so as to change oneʼs quarters, τὰ αὑτοῦ παρά τινα X.Eph. 5.13: abs., shift oneself, ἐκ . . εἰς . . Luc. Tox. 57, cf. Ach.Tat. 3.1.
clothe oneself differently, οἰκετικαῖς ἐσθήσεσιν μ. disguise oneself in . . , Polyaen. 6.49: pf. Pass., πόθεν μετεσκεύασθε; Philostr. Her.Prooem. 1.
tending to refashion or reshape material, of arts, D.L. 3.100.
alteration, modification, D.H. Comp. 6; refashioning, τῶν πόρων Cass. Pr. 69.
alter, τοὔνομα Pl. Plt. 276c.
shift an encampment, D.S. 14.32, J. AJ 3.5.1: metaph., τὸ κοινὸν πάντων ἄγαλμα μ. παρʼ ἑτέρους Him. Ecl. 13.13.

data.quote: τὸ κοινὸν πάντων ἄγαλμα μ. παρʼ ἑτέρους

children.definition: drive by scaring, Phot., Suid.
draw over from one side to another, πειρᾷ μετασπᾶν σκληρὰ μαλθακῶς λέγων S. OC 774.
hasten after, abs., J. AJ 16.2.2.
χωρὶς μὲν πρόγονοι, χωρὶς δὲ μέτασσαι, χωρὶς δʼ αὖθʼ ἕρσαι, i.e. the early-born, those born later, and the freshlings or late-born, Od. 9.221:—
τὰ μέτασσα thereafter, h.Merc. 125, cf. An.Ox. 1.280. (From μετά, after; cf. ἔπισσαι.)
summoning, dub. in Gloss.
removing, removal, πόνων S. Ichn. 217; κακοῦ And. 2.8; μετάστασιν ἴσχειν admit of removal, of disease, Hp. Aph. 5.7.
removal of the scene to some hypothetical condition, Quint. 3.6.53.

children.label: b
children.definition: shifting of blame, Hermog. Stat. 2, 6 (sg. and pl.).

children.label: II
children.definition: μεθίσταμαι) removal, migration, of Place, μ. ἐξ οἰκείας εἰς ἀλλοτρίαν Pl. Ti. 82a; εἰς τὴν γείτονα πόλιν Id. Lg. 877a; being something short of banishment, μ. τῶν πολιτῶν Id. Ep. 356e; μεταστάσεις ποιούντων ἐπʼ ἄλλον τόπον Epicur. Ep. 2p.38U.; μ. ἐπὶ τάδε καὶ ἐπʼ ἐκεῖνα τοῦ βουλευτηρίου vote, division in the Senate, D.C. 41.2; ἡλίου μ. its fabled change of course, E. IT 816.

children.label: b
children.definition: departure from life, τοῦ βίου μεταστάσεις Id. Fr. 554; ἡ ἐκ τοῦ βίου μ. Plb. 30.2.5; μ. alone, death, Simon. 32, J. AJ 17.4.1.

children.label: c
children.definition: exit of the chorus, Poll. 4.108.

children.label: d
children.definition: transference of the seat of disease, Hp. Aff. 12, Gal. 17(2).790, Aret. SA 1.7; but, dislocation, Gal. 8.246.
change, μορφῆς, γνώμης, E. Hec. 1266, Andr. 1003; μετάστασιν διδόναι (sc. θυμῷ) to allow a change to oneʼs wrath, i. e. suffer it to cease, S. Ant. 718; τοῦ φρονεῖν μ. Alex. 292.
change of political constitution, πολιτείας μ. Pl. Lg. 856c; πρώτη μ. τῶν ἐξ ἀρχῆς Arist. Ath. 41.2; at Athens, the Revolution of 404 B.C., Lys. 30.10.

children.label: b
children.definition: counter-revolution, ἐκ στάσεως μ. Th. 4.74.
one must alter, Isoc. 5.132.
connected with μετάστασις I.2, στάσις Hermog. Stat. 6; of the phrase εἰ δέ, Sch. Th. 3.65. Adv. -κῶς Aps. p.276 H., Sch. Aristid. p.289 D.
removed, ὑπὸ καθαρμῶν Hp. Morb.Sacr. 1.
go in quest of, τινα E. Hec. 509, Supp. 90.

children.label: II
children.definition: depart, in aor. 2 μετέστιχε, A.R. 3.451.
call back, restore, πνεῦμα Antyll. ap. Orib. 6.21.4.
Med., send for, summon, τινα J. AJ 17.13.3, Luc. Alex. 55, Cont. 12, PSI 4.449.11 (iv A. D.):— Pass., μετεσταλμένοι J. AJ 7.9.2.
lament afterwards, ἄτην δὲ μετέστενον Od. 4.261; μὴ μεταστένειν πόνον (Sch.; πόνων codd.) A. Eu. 59; τῆς παλαιᾶς διαίτης ἑαυτούς Ph. 1.209.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., lament after or next, σὸν ἄλγος E. Med. 996 (lyr.).
palm of the hand, Cat.Cod.Astr. 7.238.
all in a row, στὰν δὲ μ., of chariots ready to start in a race, Il. 23.358; of runners, ib. 757.
change the elementary nature of a thing, μ. γῆν transform earth into water, of Xerxes, Ph. 1.674:— Pass., δράκων εἰς βακτηρίαν μ. Id. 2.93.
change oneʼs costume, Sch. Ar. Ra. 524.
sigh or lament afterwards, Hes. Sc. 92.
go over to another general, ἐς τὸν Σύλλαν App. Mith. 51.
shift oneʼs ground or camp, Plb. 3.112.2, D.S. 14.32, Plu. Apophth. Lac. 2.228d:— Med., X. Cyr. 3.3.23; πρὸς τὸ ἄστυ Id. Ages. 2.18; εἰς τὸν ἕτερον χάρακα D.H. 9.6 ( Act. as v.l.).
one must retort, τὴν ἄγνοιαν εἰς τὸν ἐρωτῶντα Arist. SE 181a18.
fit for turning another way, fit for directing, ἐπί τι Pl. R. 525a.

definition: μεταστρέφω, aor. Pass. - εστρέφθην Il. 8.258, al., - εστράφην [ᾰ] Hdt. 3.121, etc.:—

children.definition: turn about, turn round, τῶ κε Ποσειδάων . . αἶψα μεταστρέψειε νόον Il. 15.52; εἴ κεν Ἀχιλλεὺς ἐκ χόλου . . μεταστρέψῃ φίλον ἦτορ 10.107; τὸ πρόσωπον πρός τι Pl. Smp. 190e: — Med., μεταστρέφεσθαι πρὸς τὸ μαλθακώτερον Ar. Ra. 538 (lyr.):— Pass., turn oneself about, turn about, whether to face the enemy, στῆ δὲ μεταστρεφθείς Il. 11.595, 15.591, cf. Hdt. 7.211; or to flee, τῷ δὲ μεταστρεφθέντι μεταφρένῳ ἐν δόρυ πῆξεν Il. 8.258; simply, turn round, Hdt. 3.121, Pl. Phd. 116d, etc.; turn about (to see if any one follows), Ar. Lys. 125, D. 21.221; recur, ἐπὶ τὰ προειρημένα Pl. Cra. 428d.

data.quote: τῶ κε Ποσειδάων . . αἶψα μεταστρέψειε νόον
εἴ κεν Ἀχιλλεὺς ἐκ χόλου . . μεταστρέψῃ φίλον ἦτορ
τῷ δὲ μεταστρεφθέντι μεταφρένῳ ἐν δόρυ πῆξεν

children.definition: turn round, retort, αἰτίας D. 41.13.

twist or turn all ways, πάντα μεταστρέφοντα λόγον βασανίζειν Pl. Tht. 191c; λόγους ἄνω καὶ κάτω μ. Id. Phdr. 272b; turn upside down, ἅπαντα μ. τύχη Philem. 111:— Pass., τἄνω κάτω ὁ βίος μεταστραφείς Men. 5.

misrepresent, [ δικαιοσύνης καὶ ἀδικίας] τὴν δύναμιν Pl. R. 367a: generally, change, alter, τὸ δίκαιον οὐκ ἔστι μεταστρέψαι Arist. Rh. 1376b21, cf. 1412a33; invert, τὰ τοῦ Ξενοφάνους ib. 1377a23:— Pass., ὁρᾷς γὰρ τἄμʼ ὅσῳ μετεστράφη how my fortunes are changed, E. Ba. 1329; τὸ ψήφισμʼ ὅπως μεταστραφείη Ar. Ach. 537.
ἀντὶ τοῦ ἰῶτα ἦτα μ. use one for another, Pl. Cra. 418c.

children.label: II
children.definition: turn another way, change oneʼs ways, ἦ τι μεταστρέψεις; Il. 15.203: aor. part. μεταστρέψας contrariwise, Pl. Grg. 457a (pl.), R. 587d.
turn so as to punish or avenge, of the gods, μή τι μεταστρέψωσιν ἀγασσάμενοι κακὰ ἔργα Od. 2.67 (unless trans., turn back (upon the sinners), cf. μετάτροπος 2).

data.quote: μή τι μεταστρέψωσιν ἀγασσάμενοι κακὰ ἔργα

children.definition: care for, regard, E. Hipp. 1226.
backwards, Agath. 5.19.
turning from one thing to another, ἀπό τινος ἐπί τι Pl. R. 525c, 532b.

children.label: II
children.definition: turn of events, LXX 3 Ki. 12.15.
Procl. H. 1.16:— Med., Orph. L. 739.
intercolumniation, IG 2(2).1668.63, Milet. 7p.56: pl., IG ΙΙ(2).199 A 73 ( Delos, iii B. C.); spaces between pilasters, Rev. Phil. 43.186,199; colonnade, D.C. 68.25.
strike rudely, Nonn. D. 17.164.

alter the state of the pores, a term of the Methodic school of medicine, Thessal. ap. Gal. 10.250, Sor. 2.28, Dsc. 5.6, etc.: —hence Subst. μετασύγ-κρῐσις, εως, ἡ, Id. 3.35, Sor. 2.16, Gal. 10.268: Adj. μετασυγ-κρῐτικός, ή, όν, δύναμις Dsc. 4.153, Sor. 2.15, Gal. 12.571. Adv. - κῶς v.l. in Ps.- Dsc. 2.166.
have the custom changed, Posidon. ap. Gal. 5.400.
alter the arrangement of a treatise, Vett.Val.157.30.
alter the arrangement of a sentence, Demetr. Eloc. 59, 249.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be put together, Simp. in Cael. 636.14.
alter in form, Eust. 32.42.
to be altered in form, Hsch. s.v. ἀλλοίωσις.
movement of a ball, Antyll. ap. Orib. 6.32.4.
participation, τῆς δυάδος in the nature of the dyad, Pl. Phd. 101c.

change the form of a person or thing, Pl. Lg. 903e, Arist. GC 335b26; τὸ σῶμα τῆς ταπεινώσεως Ep.Phil. 3.21; of a building, Sammelb. 5174.10 (vi A. D.):— Med., with Att. fut. - ιοῦμαι, change oneʼs form, Demetr.Lac. Herc. 1012.12; disguise oneself, J. AJ 8.11.1:— Pass., to be changed in form, Pl. Lg. 906c, Arist. Cael. 298b31, GA 747a15, D.S. 2.57; of grammatical change, A.D. Pron. 68.5, al.

children.label: II
children.definition: μ. τι εἰς ἐμαυτόν transfer as in a figure, 1 Ep.Cor. 4.6.

children.label: III
children.definition: change the posture of, Sor. 2.62 ( Pass.), al.

children.label: IV
children.definition: Pass., change their configuration, πρὸς ἀλλήλους Adam. Vent. 47.
change of form, Arist. Ph. 190b5, Cael. 305b29, Sens. 446b6.

definition: μετασχηματισμός, ὁ, = foreg., Thphr. CP 2.16.4, Plu. QConv. 2.687b tit.: in pl., Str. 1.3.3, Dsc. 1 Praef. 7, A.D. Synt. 230.3, Iamb. Myst. 7.3.

children.definition: change of position or posture, Sor. 2.21 (pl.).
one must change the attitude of, τὸν ἀγκῶνα Antyll. ap. Orib. 7.12.2.

definition: μετασχιστής, οῦ, ὁ, dub. sens. in Ostr. 1 ( Syene).

children.definition: to be changed in substance, Zos.Alch. p.108B.
change in the order of battle, Plb. 12.25F. 3 (pl.).
transpose, Arist. Metaph. 1038a30, cf. Dam. Pr. 112 (dub. l.):— Med., adjourn a trial, μ. εἰς αὔριον ἀκοῦσαι Wilcken Chr. 14.17 (i A. D.):— Pass., Arist. GC 327a19.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., change oneʼs order of battle, X. Cyr. 6.1.43; παρʼ Ἀθηναίους -τάξασθαι go over and join them, Th. 1.95; μ. πρός τινα J. AJ 5.1.17.
refashion, αὐτὸς ἑαυτὸν εἰς μάχιμον μ. Eust. 612.10.

definition: μετατίθημι, fut. - θήσω:— Med., fut. -θήσομαι D. 19.341:

children.label: I
children.definition: place among, τῷ κʼ οὔ τι τόσον κέλαδον μετέθηκε (v.l. μεθέηκεν) then he would not have caused so much noise among us, Od. 18.402.

children.label: II
children.definition: place differently,

transpose, change the place of, τὰ αἰδοῖα εἰς τὸ πρόσθεν Pl. Smp. 191b; εἰς βελτίω τόπον Id. Lg. 903d; μ. τὰς θύρας PSI 5.546.5 (iii B. C.); μετέθηκεν αὐτὸν (sc. τὸν Ἑνώχ) ὁ θεός LXX Ge. 5.24:— Pass., Arist. Int. 20b10; to be transferred, OGI 338.20 ( Pergam., ii B. C.), Act.Ap. 7.16, etc.
μ. τὸ συμπέρασμα alter a conclusion to its contrary, Arist. APr. 59b1.

change, alter, of a treaty, μεταθεῖναι ὅπῃ ἂν δοκῇ ἀμφοτέροις Foed. ap. Th. 5.18; τὸ νυνδὴ ῥηθέν Pl. Plt. 297e, cf. X. Mem. 3.14.6; μ. τινὰ ἐς πτηνὴν φύσιν AP 11.367 ( Jul.); ἐπὶ ὑὸς τὰς ἐπωνυμίας μ. change their names and call them after swine, Hdt. 5.68; substitute, προφάσεις ἀντὶ τῶν ἀληθῶν ψευδεῖς μ. D. 18.225, cf. Pl. Lg. 683b ( Pass.); correct, τοὺς ἠγνοηκότας Plb. 1.67.5; but, pervert, μετέθηκεν αὐτὸν ἡ γυνὴ αὐτοῦ LXX 3 Ki. 20(21).25.

data.quote: προφάσεις ἀντὶ τῶν ἀληθῶν ψευδεῖς μ.

children.definition: Med., change what is oneʼs own or for oneself, μ. τὰ εἰρημένα X. Mem. 4.2.18; νόμους ib. 4.4.14; τὴν δόξαν D. 18.229; τὸν τρόπον Id. 19.341; τοὔνομα Arist. Fr. 549; ὀνόματα change the use of words, Epicur. Nat. 95 G. (also in Act., Nat. 28.5); [ τὸ νόμισμα] Arist. Pol. 1257b11: abs., change oneʼs opinion, retract, Pl. R. 345b, etc.; μεταθέσθω let him change his mind, Men. Pk. 48; also in political sense, change sides, μεταθέσθαι πρὸς τὴν Ῥωμαίων αἵρεσιν Plb. 24.9.6; Dionysius of Heraclea, who went over from the Stoics to the Cyrenaics, was called μεταθέμενος, turn-coat, D.L. 7.37, 166; μ. ἀπὸ τῶν πατρίων LXX 2 Ma. 7.24; ἐξ ἀδικίας Corn. ND 11.

children.label: b
children.definition: τὴν γνώμην μετατίθεσθαι change to or adopt a new opinion, Hdt. 7.18 (but τῆς γνώμης μ. change from . . , App. BC 3.29); μετέθου λύσσαν ἄρτι σωφρονῶν thou hast changed to madness, E. Or. 254; μ. τὸ ὄνομα τὸ νῦν ἀπὸ τῶν αἰγῶν adopted their present name, Paus. 7.26.3.

children.label: c
children.definition: μ. [τὸν φόβον] transfer oneʼs fear, D. 18.177; τῇ μισθαρνίᾳ ταῦτα μετατιθέμενος τὰ ὀνόματα transferring . . , ib. 284.

children.label: d
children.definition: inf., μ. ἀντὶ τοῦ ἀπλήστως . . ἔχοντος βίου τὸν κοσμίως . . ἔχοντα βίον ἑλέσθαι change oneʼs mind and determine to choose . . , Pl. Grg. 493c.

children.label: e
children.definition: τὸ κείνων κακὸν τῷδε κέρδος μ. turning their misdeeds into his gain, S. Ph. 515 (lyr.).
Pass., to be changed, alter, μετετέθην εὐβουλίᾳ E. IA 388 (troch.); μ. ἐς Ῥωμαίους pass over, App. Hisp. 17; μ. ἀπὸ τοῦ καλέσαντος ὑμᾶς are turned away from . . , Ep.Gal. 1.6.
bring forth afterwards, A. Ag. 759 (lyr., tm.).
piece played after tragedies, of the Satyric drama, Acro ad Hor. Sat. 1.10.66.
overthrow, l.c.
turn back or away, μοῖραν -τρᾰπεῖν ( aor. 2 inf.) Pi. Fr. 177; μετὰ δʼ ὑμέας ἔτραπεν αἶσα A.R. 3.261; οὐ μετέτρεψέ σε πρωτότοκος ἀποπνέων LXX 4 Ma. 15.18.
change, νόημα AP 9.114 ( Parmen.):— Pass., ὁ γέλως ὑμῶν εἰς πένθος -τραπήτω v.l. in Ep.Jac. 4.9; μετατραπεὶς τῇ διανοίᾳ Aristeas 99 ( μετατραπείς seems to be corrupt in Plu. Symp. 2.154e).

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., turn oneself round, turn round, θάμβησεν δʼ Ἀχιλεύς, μετὰ δʼ ἐτράπετʼ Il. 1.199, etc.

Med. with aor. 2 Pass. μετετράπην, look back to, care for, show regard for, c. gen., Τρώων, τῶν οὔ τι μετατρέπῃ οὐδʼ ἀλεγίζεις 1.160, cf. 12.238; σχέτλιος, οὐδὲ μετατρέπεται φιλότητος 9.630: c. acc., οὐ μετετράπη τὸν λογισμόν LXX 4 Ma. 7.12.—Not in Prose before Aristeas.

data.quote: Τρώων, τῶν οὔ τι μετατρέπῃ οὐδʼ ἀλεγίζεις

children.definition: bring up among, in Pass., τισι A.R. 1.198, 2.1234.
run and fetch, βούλει Διοπείθη μεταδράμω; Phryn.Com. 9; οὔκουν παρʼ Ἀθηναίων μεταθρέξει; you run and get it from the A., Ar. Pax 261; run after, seek, τι Ph. 1.576, al.

children.label: II
children.definition: change oneʼs abode, πρὸς τὴν ἀνδρωνῖτιν ἑστίαν ib. 365.
turn about, οὔ τι μετατροπαλίζεο φεύγων Il. 20.190.
Hsch.
retribution, ἔτι σε μετατροπὰ τῶνδʼ ἔπεισιν ἔργων E. Andr. 492 (lyr.).

data.quote: ἔτι σε μετατροπὰ τῶνδʼ ἔπεισιν ἔργων

children.label: II
children.definition: change, σώματος γένεσις καὶ μ. Plu. QConv. 2.720b, cf. Vett.Val. 81.3 (pl.), Nech. ap. eund. 125.21, Greg.Cor. Trop.Prooem.; ἐπὶ τὰ βελτίονα μ. λαμβάνειν Hippod. ap. Stob. 4.34.71.

children.label: III
children.definition: overthrow, βασιλέων μετατροπαί Herm. ap. eund. 1.21.9 (prob.).
turn of fortune, reverse, Pi. P. 10.21 (pl.).
Hsch.
turning about, returning, μ. ἐκ βυθοῦ ἔρρων AP 7.506.5 ( Leon.), cf. Call. Del. 99; μ. αὖραι veering winds, E. El. 1147 (lyr.); πολέμον μ. αὔρα Ar. Pax 945 (lyr.).
turning round upon, δαίμων μ. ἐπί τινι A. Pers. 943 (lyr.); μετάτροπα ἔργα deeds that turn upon their author or are visited with vengeance, Hes. Th. 89.
Hsch.
transform, αἰσχρὸν ἀντὶ καλοῦ χαρακτῆρος Ph. 2.360:— Pass. (cf.sq. II), Eust. 75.5.
transformation, Ammon. Diff. p.91 V.

children.label: II
children.definition: conversion of a compound word into two simple ones, as ἀκρόπολις into ἄκρα πόλις, Eust. 626.49, cf. 75.4.

children.label: III
children.definition: λέξις ἐνηλλαγμένα στοιχεῖα ἔχουσα (as ὑπαί for ὑπό), Trypho Trop. 2.16.
look keenly after, look about for, τινα Pi. N. 10.61.

children.label: II
children.definition: shine, glitter, ἱστία μεταυγάζοντα Philostr. Im. 1.19.

speak among, and so address, in Hom. always c. dat. pl., ἀθανάτοισι Od. 1.31; ἔπεα Τρώεσσι Il. 8.496; ἔπεʼ Ἀργείοισι 2.109, cf. 18.139, al., and always in 3 sg. impf. μετηύδα, exc. 1 sg. μετηύδων Od. 12.153, 270; τοῖον ἔπος πάντεσσι μετηύδα A.R. 2.773.

children.label: II
children.definition: accost, address, ib. 54, Mosch. 4.61.
afterwards, thereupon, A. Eu. 478, 498 (lyr.), Hdt. 1.62.

definition: μέταυλος, ον, Att. for μέσαυλος (q. v.).

children.definition: the day after to-morrow, Gloss.
just after, presently after, Hdt. 2.161, 5.112.
behind the neck: τὰ μ. back of the shoulders, Poll. 2.177.

definition: μεταφέρω, fut. μετοίσω S. Ph. 962: aor. μετήνεγκα D. 18.108, part. - ενεγκών ib. 225: pf. μετενήνοχα Pl. Criti. 113a, and Pass. - ενήνεγμαι Id. Prt. 339a:—

children.definition: carry across, transfer, τι εἴς τι Id. Ti. 73e; ἐκ τῶν ἀπόρων εἰς τοὺς εὐπόρους τὰς τριηραρχίας D. 18.108; ἀπὸ τούτου ἐφʼ ἕτερον δικαστήριον Lex ap.eund. 21.94; τὴν ἀδικίαν εἰς τὸν αὑτοῦ νόμον Id. 24.76; ἐπὶ μὴ προσήκοντα πράγματα τοὺς λόγους Id. 20.113; divert funds to other uses, SIG 577.65 ( Milet., iii/ii B. C.); μ. κέντρα πώλοις apply the goad to the horses in turn, E. Ph. 178 (lyr.); μ. ἐπʼ ἀνθρώπους τὰς μηχανάς X. Cyr. 1.6.39; shift, μ. τὰ σκεύη Thphr. Char. 10.6; μ. τι ἐπὶ τἀληθές translate it into reality, Pl. Ti. 26c; μ. [τὰ ὀνόματα] εἰς τὴν αὑτῶν φωνήν translate them into their own language, Id. Criti. 113a; τὸ τῶν λῃτουργιῶν ὄνομʼ ἐπὶ τὸ τῶν ἱερῶν μ. D. 20.126; of officials, transfer to another post, BGU 15.11 ( Pass., ii A. D.); transfer a sum in an account, PRev.Laws 16.10, al. (iii B. C.):— Med., bring over with one, ἐξ Αἰγίνης Ἀθήναζε μετενεγκαμένη τὴν πορνείαν Theopomp. Hist. 244; μετηνέγκαντο τὰ σημεῖα ὡς τοὺς ἑτέρους D.H. 9.6:— Pass., to be transferred, εἰς ποίησιν Pl. Prt. 339a; μ. ἐνθένδε ἐκεῖσε Jul. Or. 3.122b.

data.quote: ἐκ τῶν ἀπόρων εἰς τοὺς εὐπόρους τὰς τριηραρχίας
τὴν ἀδικίαν εἰς τὸν αὑτοῦ νόμον
ἐπὶ μὴ προσήκοντα πράγματα τοὺς λόγους
τὸ τῶν λῃτουργιῶν ὄνομʼ ἐπὶ τὸ τῶν ἱερῶν μ.
μετηνέγκαντο τὰ σημεῖα ὡς τοὺς ἑτέρους

children.definition: change, alter, εἰ καὶ πάλιν γνώμην μετοίσεις S. Ph. 962; μ. τοὺς χρόνους D. 18.225; τὴν ἀξίωσιν μ. change, confound, Aeschin. 3.220; of Poets, μ. ταὔτʼ ἄνω τε καὶ κάτω Xenarch. 7.2:— Pass., μετενήνεκται ὑμῖν τὰ τῆς πόλεως δίκαια Aeschin. 3.193; κύνες πυκνὰ μεταφερόμεναι doubling and casting about, X. Cyn. 4.5.

data.quote: μ. ταὔτʼ ἄνω τε καὶ κάτω
μετενήνεκται ὑμῖν τὰ τῆς πόλεως δίκαια

children.definition: transfer a word to a new sense, use it in a changed sense: and abs., employ metaphor, Arist. EN 1167a10:— Pass., εὖ μετενήνεκται Id. Rh. 1405b6, cf. μεταφορά II; ἀφʼ ἑτέρων πραγμάτων μ. τὰς ὀνομασίας Phld. Rh. 1.167 S.

data.quote: ἀφʼ ἑτέρων πραγμάτων μ. τὰς ὀνομασίας

children.definition: μ. τοὔνομα ἐπὶ τὸν λόγον transfer the word to its literal meaning, re-interpret it etymologically, Arist. Top. 112a32.
boil gently, simmer, Herod.Med. ap. Orib. 8.3.1.

speak among persons, whether in addressing one or more of them, or as their spokesman, Hom. (only 3 sg. impf. μετέφη), c. dat. pl., τῇσιν (sc. δμῳαῖς) μ. Od. 18.312; πάντεσσι θεοῖσι Il. 19.100: elsewh. Hom. always joins it with τοῖς or τοῖσι, whether a single person is addressed, as in Il. 2.411, 4.153, 19.55, or more than one, as in Od. 8.132:— μετέφη c. acc. pers. is f. l. in Il. 2.795.
change the name, Man. 2.136:— Med., call by a new name, Rhian. 25.5.
pass from one to another, παρʼ ἀλλήλων μ. Str. 16.4.25.
transference, Nicom.Com. 1.35; of ownership, BGU 1127.37 (i B. C.).
transport, haulage, Hero Bel. 102.11 (pl.); οἴνου POxy. 729.24 (ii A. D.).
change, phase of the moon, Plu. Fac.lun. 2.923c.

children.label: II
children.definition: transference of a word to a new sense, metaphor, Isoc. 9.9 (pl.), Arist. Po. 1457b6, Rh. 1410b36, Epicur. Nat. 28.5, Plu. Cic. 40, Demetr. Eloc. 78 (pl.), etc.
Pherecyd. 16 ( a) J. ( Pass.), Hdt. 1.64, 2.125.
portable, ἔστι τὸ ἀγγεῖον τόπος μ. Arist. Ph. 209b29.
apt at metaphors, Ar. Po. 1459a6, Fr. 70.

children.label: II
children.definition: metaphorical, Phld. Po. 2.55, Porph. in Cat. 58.37. Adv. μεταφορικῶς Phld. Mus. p.30 K., Placit. 1.19.1, Erot. s.v. νεφέλαι, etc.
paraphrase, D.H. Th. 45, Theon Prog. 1, Hdn. Fig. p.95 S.
translate, J. AJ 8.5.3, Plu. Cat.Ma. 19, Cic. 40.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., consider after, ταῦτα μεταφρασόμεσθα καὶ αὖτις Il. 1.140.
paraphrasing, paraphrase, Plu. Dem. 8, 2.347f (pl.), Suid. s.v. Μαριανός, etc.
translator, Tz. H. 9.370.
paraphrastic, λόγος Eust. 691.20.

part behind the midriff ( μετὰ τὰς φρένας), broad of the back: hence, generally, back, μεταφρένῳ ἐν δόρυ πῆξεν ὤμων μεσσηγύς Il. 5.40, cf. 56, al.; μ. ἠδὲ καὶ ὤμω πλῆξεν 2.265; μ. ἠδὲ καὶ ὤμους (of a woman) Od. 8.528, cf. Hp. Acut. 66; in pl., of a single person, Il. 12.428; ὤμους καὶ μετάφρενα, of a woman, Archil. 29. cf. Hld. 10.32. — Ep. word, used by Pl. Prt. 352a, Arist. Phgn. 810b25, Luc. DMeretr. 4.2.

data.quote: μεταφρένῳ ἐν δόρυ πῆξεν ὤμων μεσσηγύς

children.label: II
children.definition: Ruf. Onom. 90.
get a chill, Hp. Coac. 110 (= φρίσσω in Prorrh. 1.136).

definition: μεταφύομαι, Med., c. aor. 2 Act. - έφῡν: pf. πέφῡκα:—

children.definition: become by change, ἀλλοῖοι μετέφυν Emp. 108.1, cf. Hierocl. in CA 20p.462M.; ἀνδρῶν ὅσοι δειλοὶ [ἦσαν] γυναῖκες μετεφύοντο ἐν τῇ δευτέρα γενέσει Pl. Ti. 90e; Εὔφορβος γεγονέναι μεταφῦναί τε Ἴων ἐκ Τρωός Philostr. Her. 17.

data.quote: ἀνδρῶν ὅσοι δειλοὶ [ἦσαν] γυναῖκες μετεφύοντο ἐν τῇ δευτέρα γενέσει
Εὔφορβος γεγονέναι μεταφῦναί τε Ἴων ἐκ Τρωός

children.definition: grow after, οἱ μεταφύντες (sc. ὀδόντες) Hp. Carn. 12 (- φύοντες codd., v.l. - φυέοντες, fort. - φυέντες).
transplanting, Thphr. HP 2.6.3, 7.5.3.
substitution of a different form of cultivation, Ostr.Bodl. i 89 (ii B. C.).
one must transplant, Gp. 5.13.3.
transplant, Thphr. HP 2.6.3, Philem. 147, Sor. 1.87 ( Pass.); μεταφυτέοντες is f.l. in Hp. Aër. 12.
μ. χώραν, = pastino, repastino, Gloss.
speak among, only in impf. (v. μετεῖπον), c. dat. pl., Μυρμιδόνεσσιν Il. 18.323, cf. 9.52, al.: abs., A.R. 2.1178.
accost, Id. 1.702.
undergo a change of illumination, Ptol. Alm. 3.1.
shrink from, c. gen., μεταχάσσεαι ἀμήτοιο A.R. 3.436.
change the orthography, Sch.A Il. 14.241.
change of form or type, Ammon. Diff. pp. 13,91 V.
grave anew, remodel, γῆρας μ. τὴν ἀνδρίαν εἰς τἀπρεπές Men. 552; τὸ θεῖον νόμισμα Ph. 1.220; ἰατρικήν Id. 2.560:— Pass., Id. 1.589, al.

data.quote: γῆρας μ. τὴν ἀνδρίαν εἰς τἀπρεπές

children.definition: yawn after, ἑνὸς χανόντος μετακέχηνεν ἅτερος prob. cj. for μετέσχηκεν in Apostol. 7.20 ( AJP 4.320).
to be stormy afterwards, Veget. Mil. 4.40.
Hp. Decent. 6.
treatment, handling of a topic, Sch. Aristid. p.288 D. (s. v. l.).

definition: μεταχειρίζω, aor. - εχείρισα Hdt. 3.142, etc.: but more freq. in Med. μεταχειρ-ίζομαι: Att. fut. - ιοῦμαι Lys. 24.10, Pl. R. 410b: aor. - εχειρισάμην Ar. Eq. 345, etc., rarely - εχειρίσθην Pl. Phdr. 277c: pf. - κεχείρισμαι (v. infr. 6):—

children.definition: take in hand, handle, σκῆπτρον E. Fr. 912.7 (anap.), cf. Phld. Rh. 1.225 S.:— Med., Hdt. 2.121.αʹ, Pl. Phdr. 240e: always c. acc. (the gen. in Id. R. 417a belongs only to ἅπτεσθαι, and in Id. Prm. 130d ὧν <τι> shd. be read).
have in hand, administer, [ χρήματα] Hdt. 3.142:— Med., Πηνελόπης ἱστὸν μεταχειριζομένης Pl. Phd. 84a, cf. Luc. Ind. 29; τὰς μεγίστας ἀρχὰς μ. Pl. Ti. 20a.

manage, conduct, τὰ περὶ τὰς ναῦς, τὸν πόλεμον, τὰ δημόσια, Th. 1.13, 4.18, 6.16; πρᾶγμα ὀξέως μ. ib. 12:— Med., μεταχειρίσασθαι πρᾶγμα Ar. Eq. 345; ῥώμης ἕνεκα σιτία καὶ πόνους Pl. R. 410b; ὁ νοῦς τὸ σῶμα μ. governs it, X. Mem. 1.4.17.
practise, pursue an art, study, etc., μεταχειρίζεσθαι μουσικήν, φιλοσοφίαν, παιδείαν, Pl. Plt. 268b, R. 497d, Lg. 670e, cf. Men. 81a, X. Vect. 5.4, etc.

deal with, τὸν ἑαυτῶν φονέα -όμενοι Antipho 1.20: usu. with Adv. added, handle, treat, χαλεπῶς τινας μ. Th. 7.87:— Med., τινὰς ὠμῶς μεταχειρίζεσθαι D. 24.171 (so ὡς ἀλυπότατα μ. πάθος Lys. 24.10); treat, of physicians, Pl. R. 408d.

children.label: b
children.definition: dispatch, kill, Hadr.Rh. p.45 H.
prepare a poultice, Lycus ap. Orib. 9.42.1 ( Pass.).
in the hand, Lat. in manu, i.e. slaves, CIG 3344 ( Smyrna) = Epigr.Gr. 313, where Kaibel emends to μετὰ χείρεσι.
handling, treatment, ποιήσεώς τε καὶ πεζοῦ λόγου D.H. Rh. 4.1 (- ησις codd.); ἁπάντων πραγμάτων Gal. 18(2).407.
mode of preparing, ἐπιπλάσματος Lycus ap. Orib. 9.34.1.
= foreg., τῆς κριθῆς Corn. ND 28; [ καταπλάσματος] Lycus ap. Orib. 9.25.5.
to be treated, τρίψεσι Philostr. Gym. 50.

children.label: II
children.definition: τέον, one must take in hand, treat, ἀμπέλους Gp. 7.18 tit., cf. Philum. ap. Aët. 9.25: metaph., Arist. Rh.Al. 1445b36.
treating of, τῶν ἀριθμητῶν Hero *Deff. 135.5.
aggredior, Gloss.
pour back into oneself, suck back, Opp. H. 1.572.
pour from one vessel into another, Dsc. 5.72, J. AJ 9.4.2 (prob.), Archig. ap. Orib. 8.46.16, Gp. 7.4.2:— Pass., ib. 2.7.4.
to land, μιν πλημμυρὶς . . μεταχθονίην ἐκόμισσεν A.R. 4.1269.
after-pig, i.e. the smallest, weakest of the litter, Arist. HA 573b5, GA 749a1:— μετάχοιρα shd. be restored for μετάχοιροι in Poll. 1.251.
call by a different title, τὴν δόσιν D.S. 33.17; πόλιν Diog. Ep. 43.
succeed in time, opp. πρωτοχρονεω, συγχρονέω, Diog. Oen.26.

definition: μεταχρόνιος, ον, poet. α, ον, ( χρόνος) prop.,

children.definition: happening afterwards, Tryph. 1; of an oracle post eventum, Luc. Alex. 28; delayed, Gal. 19.522.

children.label: II
children.definition: high in air, μεταχρόνιαι γὰρ ἴαλλον [Ἅρπυιαι] Hes. Th. 269, cf. A.R. 2.300, al., Pae.Oxy. 660.13, Nonn. D. 20.289, 42.1: μεταχθόνιος is suggested in Sch. A.R. 2.587; but Gramm. recognize this use of μεταχρόνιος, Hsch. s.v. μεταίσιον (leg. μετάρσιον), Apollon. Lex., EM 581.41, Suid.
out of date, anachronistic, πράγματα μ. [ὀρχεῖσθαι] Luc. Salt. 80.
transfusion, Gal. 7.542, al.
change the colour of a thing, Suid.

go to another place, remove, τόπων μετά ποι χωρεῖτʼ ἐκ τῶνδε A. Pr. 1060 (anap.); μ. εἰς [χώραν] X. HG 3.4.26; τὸ ᾠὸν μ. κάτω Arist. GA 754b29; of the foetus in the womb, change its place, Hp. Septim. 4; of birds of passage, migrate, ἐς τὴν Λιβύην Ar. Av. 710; of men, emigrate, Th. 2.72; withdraw from a conference, ἐκ τῶν λόγων Id. 5.112; go over to another party, Plu. Demetr. 29; μ. εἰς τἀναντία, of syllables, D.H. Comp. 11; change, εἰς φύσιν τινός Ael. NA 9.43.

data.quote: τόπων μετά ποι χωρεῖτʼ ἐκ τῶνδε

children.definition: departure, withdrawal, εἰς τοὺς θεούς Arr. Fr. 134 J.

children.label: II
children.definition: change of direction, in pl., Procl. Hyp. 1.27: generally, change, τοῦ δ̄ εἰς ζ̄ Eust. 1259.61.
brush against, ποδὶ πέτρον E. Ph. 1390.
remove, put elsewhere, Hsch. μεταψέφω· μεταβουλεύομαι, Id.; also μεταψέφειν· μεταμελεῖσθαι, Id.
transfer by decree, App. BC 4.57 ( Pass.).
recovery of breath ( μεταπνοή), Hsch. (Voss for μετάμιξις).
place upon a new register, Ar. Eq. 1370 ( fut. 2 Pass. μετεγγραφήσεται); re-register, τὸν ἐωνημένον Thphr. Fr. 97.3; ἑαυτὸν εἰς τοὺς ἄνδρας Sch. Pi. O. 9.134.
rewrite, prob. f.l. for μεταγρ- in Luc. Hist.Conscr. 5.
fellow-surety, POxy. 266.10 (i A. D.).
bud on another tree, in Pass., Gp. 4.8.5.
change inclination simultaneously with, Cleom. 1.5.
pour from one vessel into another, EM 149.41.

definition: μετείθη, Ion. for μεθείθη, 3 sg. aor. 1 Pass. of μεθίημι.

children.definition: to be among, c. dat. pl., ἄνδρεσσι μετέμμεναι Il. 18.91; ὄφρʼ ἂν ζωοῖσιν μετέω 22.388; οἷς ὁ γέρων μετέῃσιν 3.109; εἰ λαοῖσι μετείη Xenoph. 2.15: abs., οὐ γὰρ παυσωλή γε μετέσσεται no interval of rest will be mine, Il. 2.386.

children.label: II
children.definition: μέτεστί μοί τινος I have a share in or claim to a thing, Hdt. 1.171, etc.; τί τοῦδε σοὶ μ. πράγματος; A. Eu. 575; κἀμοὶ πόλεως μ. S. OT 630, cf. Ant. 1072, Ar. Av. 1666, 1668; πᾶσι μετεῖναι τῶν ἀρχῶν Arist. Pol. 1292a3: so part. neut. used abs., οὐδὲν μᾶλλον Αἰολεῦσι μετεὸν τῆς χώρης since they had no more share in the land, Hdt. 5.94, cf. Th. 1.28, Pl. Lg. 900e, etc.

ὁκόσον δέ μοι μέρος [τῆς γῆς τῆσδε] μετῆν Hdt. 6.107, cf. E. IT 1299, Pl. Prm. 163d; μέτεστι κατὰ τοὺς νόμους πᾶσι τὸ ἴσον (v. ἴσος II.2), Th. 2.37, Foed. ap. eund. 5.47; ἐμοὶ τούτων οὐδὲν μ. Pl. Ap. 19c.

data.quote: ὁκόσον δέ μοι μέρος [τῆς γῆς τῆσδε] μετῆν

children.definition: inf. as subj., πᾶσι μέτεστι γινώσκειν Heraclit. 116; τούτῳ τι μετέσται ψεῦδος ἀγαπᾶν . . ; will it be part of his nature to love falsehood? Pl. R. 490b, cf. 606b.

definition: μέτειμι ( εἶμι ibo), Att. fut. of μετέρχομαι (q. v.); Dor. inf. μετίμεν Foed.Delph.Pell. 2 A 25: impf. μετῄειν: Ep. aor. part. (but v. εἴσομαι II) μετεισάμενος (v. infr.):—

children.definition: go between or among, μετεισάμενος κρατερὰς ὄτρυνε φάλαγγας Il. 13.90; μετεισάμενος Τρώων ἐκέδασσε φάλαγγας 17.285.

children.label: II
children.definition: go after or behind, follow, abs., ἴθʼ, ἐγὼ δὲ μέτειμι 6.341; Ἄρης πόλεμόνδε μέτεισι 13.298; τοῦ μὲν ὑφηγουμένου, τῶν δὲ μετιόντων X. HG 4.5.8, etc.

data.quote: τοῦ μὲν ὑφηγουμένου, τῶν δὲ μετιόντων

children.definition: follow, ταὐτὸν ἴχνος Pl. Phdr. 276d.

children.label: b
children.definition: go to seek or fetch, go in quest of, μετήϊσαν ἄξοντες Hdt. 3.28; τὸν παῖδα εὗρον οἱ μετιόντες ib. 15; ἐν ᾧ δὲ τούτους μετήϊσαν ib. 19; εἰ γάρ μʼ ἀπώσῃ, . . μέτει πάλιν S. El. 430; μετῇσαν στρώματα Ar. Eq. 605, cf. Ach. 728; μ. τινὰ . . ἐκ . . Id. Pax 274; τὰ ἐπιτήδεια ἐκ Σηστοῦ μετιόντας X. HG 2.1.25: metaph., search after, pursue, τέχνην Pl. Phdr. 263b, Arist. Sens. 436a21; ἑκάστας [τὰς ἀρχὰς] ᾗ πεφύκασιν Id. EN 1098b4; μ. περί τινος Id. Rh.Al. 1432b3, al.; περί τι Id. Metaph. 1044b4; μ. τὸν λόγον Pl. Men. 74d, Sph. 252b: abs., pursue a question, οἱ οὕτω μετιόντες Arist. APo. 91b24, cf. Pl. Smp. 210a, etc.

data.quote: εἰ γάρ μʼ ἀπώσῃ, . . μέτει πάλιν

children.label: c
children.definition: pursue with vengeance, εἰ μὴ μέτειμι τοῦ πατρὸς [φόνου] τοὺς αἰτίους A. Ch. 273, cf. Ag. 1666 (troch.), S. El. 478 (lyr.); also in Th., τιμωρίαις τοὺς ἀδικοῦντας μ. 4.62; μ. δίκας τινά ( δίκας acc. cogn.) execute judgement upon one, A. Eu. 231; τὸν διδάσκαλον δίκην μέτειμι E. Ba. 346; ἄποινα μέτεισι Διόνυσός σε ib. 517.

data.quote: εἰ μὴ μέτειμι τοῦ πατρὸς [φόνου] τοὺς αἰτίους

children.label: d
children.definition: pursue, go about, δόλῳ μέτειμι . . φόνον Id. Med. 391.

children.label: e
children.definition: canvass for an office, μ. ὑπατείαν, Lat. ambire consulatum, Plu. Publ. 11; ἀρχήν Id. Cic. 1.

children.label: f
children.definition: μ. θυσίῃσι [τοὺς ἀνέμους] approach them with sacrifices, Hdt. 7.178: c. acc. et inf., ἕνα ἕκαστον μετῄεσαν μὴ ἐπιτρέπειν besought each one not . . , Th. 8.73; also ἕκαστον μετιόντες ὅπως ἀποστήσωσιν Id. 3.70 (unless ἀ. goes with ἔπρασσον).

children.label: III
children.definition: pass by, A.R. 2.688.
pass over, πρός τινα Hdn. 5.4.6.
recur, return, ἐκεῖσε ὅθεν ἀπέσχισάς με τοῦ λόγου μέτειμι Ar. Nu. 1408, cf. Ach.Tat. 6.2.

data.quote: ἐκεῖσε ὅθεν ἀπέσχισάς με τοῦ λόγου μέτειμι

definition: μετεῖπον, Ep. μετέειπον, aor. 2 of μεταφωνέω,

children.definition: speak among, address, c. dat. pl.; freq. in Hom., mostly in phrases, ὅ σφιν ἐϋφρονέων ἀγορήσατο καὶ μετέειπεν Il. 1.253, al.; τοῖσι δὲ καὶ μετέειπε 2.336, al., cf. Hes. Th. 643: abs., mostly with ὀψέ, Il. 7.94, Od. 7.155, etc.— Hom. always uses 3 sg. Ep. μετέειπε, exc. once 1 sg. μετέειπον, Od. 19.140.

data.quote: ὅ σφιν ἐϋφρονέων ἀγορήσατο καὶ μετέειπεν

definition: μετείς, Ion. aor. 2 part. of μεθίημι.
μετεισάμενος, Ep. aor. 1 part. Med. of μέτειμι ( εἶμι ibo).

children.definition: go into another ship, Hld. 5.27.
change and slip into another shell, Arist. HA 548a16.
pass into, Phot. s.v. ἐρινάζειν.

definition: μετείω, Ep. subj. pres. of μέτειμι ( εἰμί sum).

childrenʼs children, Sch. Aristid. p.651 D.

interval between two Olympic truces, SIG 1021.1 ( Olympia, i B. C.), etc.

consonant, dub. in Phld. Po.Herc. 994.34.
drive to fresh pasture, πρόβατα Philostr. VA 8.22.
confute, f.l. for μετʼ ἐλέγχων in Iamb. VP 32.218.
sequence, succession, χρόνων Vett.Val. 219.11.

children.definition: change of treatment, Sor. 2.15, 29.
one must punish, Luc. Fug. 22.
go on board another ship, Plu. Ant. 66; εἰς λῃστρικόν Id. Luc. 13.
transition, ἐκ τῶν ζῳδίων Vett.Val. 336.20 (pl.).
put on board another ship, ἐς ἄλλην ναῦν μ. Th. 8.74 (v.l. μετεκβιβάζω) ; ἐρέτας μ. change the crew, Polyaen. 5.41.

definition: μετέμμεναι, Ep. inf. of μέτειμι ( εἰμί sum).

engrafted afresh, AP 9.4 ( Cyllen.).
to pass from one body into another, Olymp. in Phd. p.55 N., al.

transmigration of souls, D.S. 10.6, Gal. 4.763, Alex.Aphr. de An. 27.18, Porph. Abst. 4.16, Herm. ap. Stob. 1.49.69 tit., Sallust. 20 (pl.), Hieronym. Ep. 124.4, Procl. in R. 2.340 K., Theol.Ar. 40 (pl.), Olymp. in Phd. p.54 N., Sch. Iamb. Protr. 14, Sch. E. Hipp. 736; non μ. sed παλιγγενεσίαν esse dicit (Pythagoras), Serv. ad Verg. A. 3.68.

children.definition: put on other clothes, μετένδυνε τὴν λευκὴν ἐσθῆτα Them. Or. 13.178d.

one must refer, δεῦρο Str. 13.1.64; one must transfer, Sor. 2.46, al.
metaphorically, Porph. in Cat. 67.28.
speak among, τισι A.R. 3.1168, Mosch. 2.101.
to be put into another body, of the soul, Plot. 1.1.12, 4.3.9, Hierocl. Prov. p.461 B.
transmigration of the soul, Hippol. Haer. 1.3.2, Plot. 2.9.6 (pl.), 4.3.9, Olymp. in Phd. p.54 N.; τῶν ψυχῶν Herm. in Phdr. p.61 A., Hierocl. Prov. p.172 B.
= Lat. translatio mandati, Cod.Just. 2.12.27.2.
put into another place:— Med., aor. 2 μετενεθέμην, τὸν γόμον shift a shipʼs cargo, D. 56.25.
= foreg., τὸν γόμον μ. D. 56.24; put ashore for transshipment, PCair.Zen. 93.12 (iii B. C.).

Ph. Bel. 58.2 (s.v.l.).
transfer from one vessel to another, τὰ σκόρδα ἐκ . . πλοίου εἰς τὴν θαλαμηγόν PSI 4.332.9 (iii B. C.).
